name: Hyde Park - Walk to UChicago, 10 min to McCormick
description:
Visiting The University of Chicago or attending a conference or convention at McCormick Place? You are invited to be the sole Airbnb guest in a quiet, vintage, 2nd floor apartment shared only with me. My co-op is one block from the eastern border of the University of Chicago and a 10 min Metra train ride to McCormick Place. This Hyde Park location is easily accessible by public transportation (or shared car service) to/from both Midway and O’Hare Airports.

The space
The private bedroom has a queen size bed, bedside tables w/lamps, a chest, desk and chair, and Smart TV. The large closet contains plenty of hangers, an iron and ironing board, a garment steamer, and extra bedding. There is room in the large closet to store your luggage.

All bedding (including mattress pad and duvet cover or quilt) is freshly laundered for each guest. During extended stays, weekly housekeeping is provided to the guest room - at no additional charge.

The bathro
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is less than one block from beautiful Jackson Park which houses the Museum of Science and Industry and the Japanese Gardens, built for the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition. Theaters, restaurants, grocery stores, book stores, and lakefront bicycle/running paths are within walking distance. This Hyde Park location is served by both the city and  UChicago police departments.
host_about:
My 2 bdrm apartment is a 2nd floor walk-up in a quiet, vintage co-op building, overlooking a pleasant courtyard.  I allow only one guest so you don't have to worry about other strangers in the apartment. (I occupy the 2nd bedroom).  A single traveler will feel safe and be comfortable here. If you are visiting the University of Chicago - or visiting your UChicago student who hasn't enough room to host you - my location will allow you to walk to your destination. My apartment is probably the Airbnb listing most convenient to the Chicago Theological Seminary. 

If you have been skeptical about  trying Airbnb, you will be pleasantly surprised at how drama-free the experience can be. The key is to read the listing (including house rules) and the reviews, then select a place that meets your safety, location, and comfort needs.

Let me know the purpose of your trip to Chicago so I can help you determine if my apartment or Hyde Park location is (or isn't) right for your visit.  I may even be able to suggest a more appropriate location. In any event, I will answer your inquiries quickly and honestly.

name: 394 Great Reviews. 127 y/o House. 40 yds to train.
description:
We have been closed for quite a while and will remain closed until early May, 2021.

Across the street from CTA train. Runs every 6-10 minutes most of the day, 8-14 minutes late night, best way to get around.

We are scared, you are scared, we are all scared to varying degrees. We will do everything possible to make your stay here as safe as possible, including 48 hours between guests. We asked that you respect our safety and use common sense precautions during your visit here.

The space
We travel a lot, we know what people need. We've been doing this a while, ( we are the oldest Airbnb in Chicago) we know what people want. Simply put, we do it right. The reviews speak for themselves.
You can rent an entirely furnished, really cool, comfortable apartment designed for travelers, for a great price. It's a really nice, really big place for one person, big enough for 7 persons (but ONLY one bathroom). Nobody lives in the apartment, it's us
host_about: Incredibly creative(Kathleen) and stunningly amusing/disturbing(Craig) Chicago artists who have to work for a living. Dog and cat unemployed. As good Chicagoans, all four of us support Obama (Hillary), so if you're Republican, you might want to stay somewhere else, ...like, uh, maybe Kentucky. Just to clarify, we've been to Kentucky and it's a very nice place to visit.  Would never live there.

name: Tiny Studio Apartment 94 Walk Score
description:
A very small studio in a wonderful neighborhood.

The space
This is a very small studio apartment with a private entrance.

The apartment is located on the rear half of our first floor. It has its own entrance. It consists of a kitchen and a small bedroom with a queen sized bed (new since October 2016) and bathroom with a tub and shower. There is a kitchen with a stove and mini fridge and sink and microwave plus a small table for two. We have a Roku Box for tv watching and excellent cable internet. The Roku has Amazon Prime, Netflix and a bunch of other channels. We have hi-speed Comcast internet
I teach an Airbnb Experience in Soapmaking upstairs in my apartment, so let me know if you want to schedule a class at your convenience while you are here! (https://www.airbnb.com/experiences/52598)

Guest access
You will be in your own private, tiny apartment. You will not see me or my family at all unless you run into us outdoors
neighborhood_overview:
Ukrainian Village was just named "Hottest Neighborhood in America" by Trulia. Our address has a walk score of 94 because it has an awesome combination of places to walk to, public transportation options and rental bikes all over the place.
We are in a convenient location one block away from multiple bars, restaurants, boutiques, etc. you can walk to the El from the apartment (1/2 mile) and take it straight downtown to the museums or to O'Hare airport in the other direction. Our neighborhood is called Ukrainian Village and we are a historic district which means most of the buildings are old and the neighborhood has lots of character. We were granted this status in part because it is an unusual neighborhood with numerous Orthodox churches and cathedrals. It is a nice place to walk around. You can walk to the Ukrainian Institute of Modern Art Museum and the Ukrainian National Museum. You can also get Ukrainian food and pastries. The neighborhood has changed in recent years, howe
host_about: We live in Chicago. We love to travel and see the world with our two children!

name: Barbara's Hideaway - Old Town
description:
One-bedroom hideaway tucked into Old Town steps from Lincoln Park, the zoo, and the lakefront path. World-class dining and shopping surrounds you. Full kitchen and bathroom, queen bed, baby grand piano, lovely patio, washer and dryer, much more!

The space
This lovely one bedroom "hideaway" is located in Old Town, close to the park, the Lincoln Park Zoo, and the Chicago Lakefront Path. This vacation rental is perfect for those who want to be able to walk to experience Chicago's beautiful lakefront activity, or those who love world-class shopping and dining.

There are also several great restaurants in walking distance. It has a queen size bed, living room, with a baby grand, full kitchen and bathroom.

There's a lovely patio in the back for guest's use in the warmer months. W/D in the unit, high speed internet and cable tv. Parking can be arranged nearby; otherwise, street parking is available. This a non-smoking accommodation near Lincoln and
neighborhood_overview:
Chicago’s Old Town neighborhood is squeezed between the edges of Lincoln Park, Goose Island, and the Gold Coast, about a mile north of The Loop.

This cozy neighborhood of tree-lined streets and old victorian-era buildings oozes an old Chicago feel, from it’s well-heeled restaurants and taverns to its thriving theatre and performance scene. This affluent, historic neighborhood is notably home to one of only seven churches that survived the Great Chicago Fire, St. Michael’s Church.

The neighborhood is great for strolling around, one of the most dense and walkable in the city.

The Old Town Art Fair is one of Chicago’s most popular street festivals. Each June more than 250 artists display work of all mediums at the fair, which also hosts live music, a garden walk, and tours of the historic neighborhood.

Old Town is also home to a wide array of small independent boutiques, though you’ll also find familiar names and restaurants within its boundarie
host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing throughout the city in or near Old Town and Lincoln Park.

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City.  Topo Gigio is a great local Italian Restaurant and The Gemini Bistro is an excellent choice for fine dining. And Velvet Taco, casual with its own unique style on Lincoln is fabulous!

The free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

name: The Biddle House (#1)
description:
Beautiful first floor apartment in Historic Old Town. Tree-lined street, walking distance to countless wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront.

Beyond Charming, Two-bedroom unit, with one queen and one double, a full kitchen and bathroom.

The space
This 1st floor apartment has a queen size bed in one bedroom and a double in the other bedroom. The bathroom has a bathtub and shower.

The apartment includes high speed internet (wi-fi) cable tv, private phone lines, and a complimentary washer and dryer in the building.

Public transportation is terrific from this location; you can take the train (brown line) downtown in just 10 minutes!

You'll be a short walk from the Lincoln Park Zoo, Chicago History Museum, world-famous Second City, great restaurants and bars like Twin Anchors (an old Sinatra hangout), Old Town Social, and Marges.

Max occupancy per apartment is 5. Closest major intersection is North A

name: Chicago GOLD COAST 1 Bedroom Condo
description:
Available as extended stay rental located in Chicago's Gold Coast / Old Town, steps to the Clark/Division subway entrance. Parking available separately. Beautifully & fully furnished; on the 16th floor with unobstructed, sunny west views with wifi/Internet, HDTV SmartTV with Netflix and Pandora and utilities.

The space
Monthly parking available for additional fee. Well-appointed, fully furnished one bedroom hotel-style condo with parking available separately. Located at Lasalle & Division in Chicago's Gold Coast; a short walk or cab ride from Lake Michigan dining/shopping and lakefront.
Two Equinox clubs are nearby (about six blocks away); the 900 North and Lincoln Park locations.
Wifi, Netflix, bedding/bath towels, utilities, and fully equipped kitchen included in rental. Wood floors throughout.
Living room with 48" Samsung Smart HDTV with Netflix, Pandora and other apps.
Gourmet granite kitchen with full size appliances and also a break
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is on Lasalle just off of Division; it's very close to almost everything. The subway entrance is right outside the front lobby door of the building.
Less than two blocks away, you will find a Jewel grocery store, Starbucks coffee shop, CVS pharmacy, wine shop and many other places.
A number of Chicago's most famous bars are located 2 blocks away on Division including Mother's bar where "About Last Night" and "Class" were filmed.
The Viceroy Hotel is 4 blocks away and features a restaurant and lounge.
A wide variety of restaurants are close by; Rush street nightlife (Hugo's Frog Bar, etc) is 4 to 5 blocks away (a 5 minute walk).
Wells Street is 1 block away and has many great brunch and dinner places, along with a gourmet grocery store.

name: Lincoln Park Guest House
description:
The space
Luxurious and modern accommodations in the heart of Chicago’s hottest neighborhood: Lincoln Park – perfect for business or leisure travelers. This beautiful king suite overlooks DePaul University and is at the spot center of a vibrant, upscale and historic neighborhood noted for its plenitude of retail boutiques, fantastic eateries, live theatre, jazz clubs, and coffee shops.

Quick transportation to The Loop, Millennium Park, McCormick Place and the Magnificent Mile. Accessible by CTA trains from both Chicago airports.

The private guest suite features a two-story cathedral ceiling with skylight, king bed is upholstered in leather with a memory foam pillow top mattress and premium Vera Wang linens. Private bath with personal amenities; hair dryer, iron and ironing board. A mini-refrigerator is stocked with bottled water and sodas or juices and Keurig machine available for coffees and tea. This property is not ADA accessible. Thirteen steps le
neighborhood_overview: The Guest House is in the heart of Chicago's most popular neighborhood: Lincoln Park, next to DePaul University, walking distance to scores of fabulous boutiques, restaurants, live theatre, music venues, parks, and a 10-15 minute taxi or CTA train ride to the Loop, Millennium Park and Magnificent Mile. Fullerton Station, a major CTA train stop is two blocks away. It's all happening in Chicago's hottest neighborhood: walk a few blocks to the Steppenwolf Theatre (featuring Hollywood's finest) or shop in the city's best boutiques.
host_about:
Best in the city with long-time urban-dwelling hosts available to give you the skinny on most things Chicago, while allowing you complete privacy in your own large, separate suite area, accessed via a private stairway.

Luxurious and pristine accommodations with a modern décor in the heart of Chicago’s Lincoln Park – perfect for business or leisure travelers. Located in the spot center of lively city life, it is minutes from the Loop, Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park.

name: Luxury in Chicago! 2BR/ 2Ba / Parking / BBQ
description:
Fantastic condo in a Great Location with covered balcony, gas BBQ and parking! Overlooks Eckert Park. Corner unit.
Parks, restaurants, bars, art galleries, public transportation, library, coffee shops, grocery stores all within walking distance.
Easy access to downtown, the Magnificent Mile, Bucktown, Wicker Park, and West Loop.
2 bedrooms / 2 baths each w/ lots of privacy, 2 parking spaces, fully furnished, fireplace, corner unit with tons of light.
We know you will enjoy our home and our city!

The space
Our home is Fully Furnished & Equipped!! Just move in your clothes, personal items and Enjoy! The West Town neighborhood is situated perfectly... near the Loop and right in the vibrant West Town / Wicker Park area. The 'Hot' area of Chicago right now!!

We travel the world and AirBnB is our go-to site for all accommodations worldwide. We know what we want in a rental and we've worked hard to make sure you'll have the same great
neighborhood_overview:
Our home overlooks the park and is on a quiet, safe and peaceful street.
Just a block or two away, the excitement picks up with restaurants, bars, art galleries, cross-fit gyms, a huge library, shopping, and so much more. The heart of Chicago and Lake Michicagn are just a few minutes away by bus or subway, and on nice days a walk or bike ride is a great way to explore the city from our home.
The park across the street is massive with softball fields, basketball court, indoor pool & fitness center, and a brand new playground for the kids to enjoy.
We're located in the middle of 5 tremendous neighborhoods with plenty of new spaces and places to explore. You won't be disappointed. Come enjoy Chicago and make our home your Home Base.
host_about: Entrepreneur, Business Owner, Avid Traveler, Athlete, Snowboarder, Beach Lover, Adventurer, Wakeboarder, Chiller, Runner, Beer Lover, Life Liver!

name: Private Apt 1 Block to Fullerton L Red Line - Deck
description:
Perfect private apartment one block from Fullerton L station, a major L station. Whole Foods is also one block away!

The space
Rent LincolnPark welcomes you to your perfect Chicago holiday. Family owned and operated for over 20 years, Blarney's Brownstone is a charming 4-unit brownstone located on a quiet side street in the heart of Lincoln Park. With the Fullerton L stop one block away, enjoy easy access to the Loop/downtown, Grant Park, Navy Pier, Wrigley Field, the lakefront, Millennium Park, State Street, Museum campus, the Art Institute, Michigan Avenue, and many of Chicago’s endless activities.

This unit has beautiful hardwood floors and an exposed brick wall in the living room. It is tastefully furnished and comes with a fully equipped modern kitchen. An eat-in-kitchen bar, and a living room with a fireplace (non-working). There is a desk in the living room for anyone trying to complete work. The spacious bedroom has a queen-sized bed.
neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is a great neighborhood where people live and work. There are many shops, bars and restaurants in walking distance. We have a walk score of 95!
host_about:
Travel is fun and exciting but can be hard on the wallet.  It doesn't have to be that way.  Email if you have questions, especially if your requested dates are in the near term and I will do my best to work with you!

Having spent more time than I care to remember in sterile, uninviting hotel rooms, I was initially attracted to vacation rentals as refreshing, and often more affordable, alternatives.  What I found were the same white walls and beige furniture or, even worse, cluttered rooms and Aunt Edna's donated dilapidated couch in the living room.  Well, welcome to something different.  Take a break from your busy schedule by relaxing in clean, inviting rental that that feels enough like home that you're immediately comfortable while being so special you'll look forward to your return.  Many of my guests have been back 2 or 3 times, and some have found themselves venturing across the country to check out another Red Hot Vacation Rental.  

My places are located in Chicago, Miami Beach and San Francisco. I've lived in all 3 cities and am happy to suggest hidden local gems or recommend the best nearby dry cleaner.

Note - during the summer, please do not Instant Book for anything less than 70 nights.

The space
This top-floor 2 bedroom, 1 bath unit is tastefully furnished and comes with an equipped modern granite kitchen, small dining area and a living room in addition to the 2 bedrooms (one queen bed, one double) and bath. There is a sofa and an air mattress is provided for the living room for additional guests. Full marble bath with skylight.

name: Sanitized, Huge, Quirky Bucktown Loft + Parking
description:
I've been hosting travelers from all over the world since 2009.
Located on a peaceful treelined street in energetic, fashionable Bucktown with upscale amenities at your fingertips. This unique penthouse apartment has its share of quirks that come with being a 125-year-old building yet its unique vintage comfort, eclectic furnishings and modern necessities come together to make your time in the city relaxing and unforgettable. This is a legally licensed Chicago vacation rental.

The space
Impeccably clean and well appointed one of a kind 3 Bedroom, 2 bathroom attic/loft apartment in a quiet residential area in Bucktown. This dramatic and spacious unit incorporates 2 floors and has a retro /vintage /European feel with many primitive antiques and a romantic claw foot tub in the living room. Upon entering the top floor the church lights and 12 foot vaulted ceilings hover over the open space unveiling the living, dining, and kitchen areas. There are the original w
host_about: i've owned the building since 1993 and been hosting airbnb's in chicago and my home in italy since its startup. i live in italy but there is an onsite building manager in chicago for emergencies and i am easy to reach via email, texting and calling. also, my niece lives in the neighborhood and is a superhost.

name: Andersonville - Perfect location!
description:
Comfort and style. Recently named as one of the 10 unbelievable Airbnbs in Chicago by Thrillist.

The space
We have a private bedroom available in our home in Andersonville, a quaint neighborhood in the middle of a world-class city. The bedroom will accommodate two people very comfortably with queen bed, cable, wireless internet, with large window that brings in plenty of light. Shared bath with heated tile floors.

Our outdoor space is fantastic. If you feel like relaxing in the yard all day, that's perfect. You can enjoy your morning coffee or evening drinks on our huge deck overlooking our stream and pond.
Say hello to the fish and turtle.

Our home is all access. Feel free to relax any place you feel comfortable.

We work from home and love some distraction from work. :) Both of us enjoy sharing our time with our guests. Join us for coffee in the morning or cocktails in the evening.

Guest access
Ou
neighborhood_overview:
We love this neighborhood and hope you will too!

Andersonville is now considered one of Chicago's “hot" neighborhoods. It also enjoys nationwide renown for its unique commercial district, comprised almost entirely of locally owned, independent businesses. It demonstrates what Andersonville locals have known for a long time: that the locally owned businesses are a crucial part of Andersonville's vitality and quality of life, returning far more to the community in economic benefits and neighborhood involvement than would non-local businesses. Communities everywhere now look to emulate Andersonville as a model of a thriving urban neighborhood. Visit (URL HIDDEN) for more details. You can access the redline train or bus line to access downtown Chicago and all the attractions. Commute to City center is about 20 minutes.
host_about:
We love to travel on a budget, no big hotels for us. We do our best to experience our trips like locals. We love the outdoors, hiking, camping, and having visitors. You will find us most times digging in the yard or enjoying a cold beer(s) with friends. 

Mat is self employed and works from home.  Randy has been a Kindergarten teacher in public schools for 26 years.

Airbnb brings travel to us and we LOVE IT!

A peaceful shared space in Chicago's Ukrainian Village Neighborhood. Perfect for students and couples staying 3 days or more. Shopping, dining, nightlife, sightseeing, buses, rental bikes are all within steps from the apartment. CTA Bus or bike rental across the street from the house. Get to anywhere downtown, ballparks, museums, lakefront beaches/parks in about 30 minutes.

The space
Mike, Vero (and dog Piper) live in a 3 bedroom apartment above a pilates studio. Your guest bedroom is located in the front of the apartment, directly outside of the living room/TV room, which has a beautiful view of our vibrant neighborhood.

The bedroom has a large storage closet, queen bed with extra sheets & towels, small table and chair for studying. There is also a larger table outside the bedroom, near the WiFi internet router, that you are welcome to use at any time to bring your laptop or just enjoy a meal and watch the neighbors walk by.

The Living roo
neighborhood_overview:
Ukrainian Village / West Town is a beautifully tree-lined neighborhood, with ornate churches, large historic homes, delicious food, fun bars, nightclubs, cafes, shopping...We've got maps!

Hot breakfast is available at Sunrise Cafe, which is just down the street. Also check out Feed, Dark Matter (coffee), Bite, Whisk, Roots Pizza. Lunch, Dinner and drinks are available at El Metro Cantina and KoKo's Mediterranean Grill (both on Chicago Avenue)
host_about:
Hi! We are both local business owners in the neighborhood. Mike is a Massage Therapist and Veronica is a restaurant owner.
We've been an Airbnb guest and host for a few years now and made some great friendships, as well as met some pretty wonderful people! 

Mike loves to create music and explore art/new music/explore/eat pizza, bacon, cheese, and anything with potatoes. I also love spending time with my dog Piper! She is a sweet 3 year old (Shepard mix) who loves to do tricks for treats and really likes people who like dogs :)
Veronica makes art, draws and works at her restaurant just down the street from the house..you should come by!!!

If you are bilingual in English/Spanish, "Yo hablar un poco de español" with you, since my girlfriend has inspired me to take lessons for our trips to Mexico City. She also owns the best Mexican restaurant , just down the street.  Hasta luego!

neighborhood_overview: Uptown  is considered the most diverse neighborhood in Chicago. There are a wide range of ethnic restaurants within walking distance to the apartment - Ethiopian, Indian, Mexican, Nigerian, Sushi, Thai, and Vietnamese. The Uptown Entertainment District is home to various music venues, nightclubs, restaurants and theatres. The famous Green Mill Jazz Club, which offers jazz 7 days a week, is 4 blocks from the apartment. Uptown is also a stop for Chicago Gangster tours, with many locations tied to infamous gangsters such as John Dillinger, and Al Capone. As in any big city, it is important to beware of your surroundings when walking at night. Uptown is a great location for jazz buffs, people who like to run, ride a bike and that needs access to tourist sites while not be in the middle of them.  The apartment is walking distance to Lincoln Park and Lake Michigan. It is a 5 minute walk to the running/bike path and 10 minutes to the beach. There is a DIVVY bike rental available 1/2 block awa
host_about: I am an easy going, flexible host.I want my guests to feel comfortable to ask for my help when needed and to feel at home. I let my guests do their own thing unless they need my assistance. I work at a non-profit as the Manager of Volunteer Relations. I've traveled all over the world and love the idea of hosting other travelers. My travel experiences range from staying in First Class hotels to BB's or homestays.   I've lived in the same apartment for over 20 years and feel comfortable in helping visitors with things to do in Chicago.

neighborhood_overview:
Since the 1970s, Albany Park has been a point of entry for immigrants from Asia and Latin America and is one of the most ethnically diverse in the United States. It has one of highest percentages of foreign-born residents of neighborhoods in Chicago. As one of Chicago's most ethnically diverse neighborhoods, it boasts an unmatched array of multicultural restaurants, including local favorite Noon-O-Kabab and the celebrated falafel of Semiramis.

Along the Lawrence Avenue corridor, you will discover independently-owned grocery stores, delicious Korean cuisine and a collection of highly regarded Middle Eastern and Mexican restaurants.

But Albany Park is more than delicious Pad Thai and perfectly roasted kabobs. This charming community vaunts year-round musical and stage performances by the Albany Park Theater Project.

host_about:
Welcome! I'm a TESOL graduate student living in Chicago with my small but mighty dog Clarence. Live music, films, language, and art are my favorite things, next to bicycles, dogs, and social justice worldwide! I also study Swedish.

I enjoy solo travel (and love to stay in interesting Airbnb homes!) and meeting new people, and I hope you enjoy this great city and its neighborhoods during your visit with me. My apartment and garden is always a work in progress - very homey, humble, and (I hope!) comfortable, and just a short train ride to downtown.

Wishing you all health and safety during this crisis. <3

name: Historic Pullman Artist Flat - Artists & Explorers
description:
Charming original 1880's Pullman workers flat in a wonderfully diverse community off the beaten path - Now a National Monument! Artists, historians, preservationists, architects, urban planners... Great place for creatives and explorers visiting Chicago! Your stay supports our visiting artist program. Please tell us a little about yourself. (WEEKLY AND MONTHLY DISCOUNTS)

The space
Enjoy the entire 2nd Floor apartment of an original 1880's Pullman workers two flat row house. The building has been converted to Artist Live/Work Space (working art studio on the 1st floor / apartment on 2nd floor - you will be renting the entire private 2nd floor apartment). Kitchen (with everything you need), relaxed backyard, washer dryer in the basement (if desired, by request). The building has been featured on several Historic Pullman House Tours over the years. Unique space with lots of original charm. 20-30 minutes to downtown Chicago via metra train or quick access to the h
neighborhood_overview:
The entire town of Pullman was built in the 1880's as an industrialists utopian community to house his factory workers. It remains remarkably intact and is now part of the City of Chicago. Pullman has recently been designated a National Monument and is part of the US National Park Service (bring your NPS passport!) with friendly Park Rangers, self-guided and organized tours, a visitor center, and more. Explore labor history, model towns / planned communities, gilded age industrialism, all in a living/breathing community filled with preservationists, artists, creatives and the friendliest people you will find anywhere.

NOTES ON PULLMAN: The Pullman community is located on the far south side of Chicago and is in my opinion one of the most interesting and diverse areas of the city. People come from all over the world to see the historical remains (incredibly intact) of an industrialists utopia once touted "the worlds most perfect town" (now a National Monument). It is not the
host_about:
Conceptual artist loves to explore... 

I've traded homes with artist friends from all over the USA and Europe and have shared spaces with dear friends and acquaintances long before airbnb was created (airbnb now expands those possibilities!). I think this is by far the most interesting and rewarding way to travel and experience some "there" there. I look forward to hosting and staying. 

I live in a 1880's  workers 2-flat converted to an apartment on the second floor and art studio on the first floor in the Historic Pullman neighborhood in Chicago, IL. I have a small organic food garden in the back and love to cook/prepare; raw, vegan/vegetarian, organic/healthy/gourmet - I'm not obliged to any specific diet so I enjoy lots of different foods and flavors. I try and learn one new thing a year - last year it was learning restoration of 1880's slate roof/facades with a craftsman and architect friends. This year, bringing artists to Pullman and Pullman to artists. Next, maybe exploring more permaculture ideas/trends.  

I have an absolutely lovely girlfriend who travels with me whenever possible (Amy). She is a social delight and has a wonderful way with people/cultures (like insisting on learning/speaking Spanish when we explored Spain). She offers a genuine ease with meeting new people and a welcoming charm. You'll like her.

Looking forward to meeting you...

-jb

name: Pullman Art Studio - One Person - Monthly Rental
description:
Create you own art residency! 1st floor Artist studio in an 1880's Pullman factory town workers flat. Bedroom with double bed, kitchen (with stove, small fridge, utensils, etc.), bath (with tub/shower), office, large work surfaces, good light and even boasts an 1880's rosenback perforator! WiFi. Not suitable for kids. 30 day minimum rental. We practice social distancing and other common sense on the premises. Please let us know how you plan to use the space so we can be sure it is a fit.

The space
The studio has been host to visiting artists from around the world. Truly unique space with lots of original charm. 20-30 minutes to downtown Chicago via metra train or quick access to the highway. Located in the heart of the Pullman Historic Landmark District. Not suitable for children.

Linens and towels are provided. Plenty of free street parking. Shared Laundry in basement.

Please contact to confirm availability and let me know a little abou
neighborhood_overview: NOTES ON PULLMAN: The Pullman community is located on the far south side of Chicago and is in my opinion one of the most interesting and diverse areas of the city. People come from all over the world to see the historical remains (incredibly intact) of an industrialists utopian company town once touted "the worlds most perfect town".  It is not the gold coast or your typical Chicago tourist spot but is instead a multicultural community engaged in preservation, restoration and re-purpose/reuse. There is a big box super store within walking distance (about a mile), a new food court with bbq and vegan options, and my favorite - an eccentric diner/restaurant for fluffy pancakes (breakfast/lunch) three blocks away. But most of your shopping /dining will likely be outside of the community (Hyde Park is a short drive or train ride away with lots of dinning, shopping, etc). Pullman is truly unique and filled with charm (and only 20-30 mins to downtown Chicago). I'm pretty sure you will fall in
host_about:
Conceptual artist loves to explore... 

I've traded homes with artist friends from all over the USA and Europe and have shared spaces with dear friends and acquaintances long before airbnb was created (airbnb now expands those possibilities!). I think this is by far the most interesting and rewarding way to travel and experience some "there" there. I look forward to hosting and staying. 

I live in a 1880's  workers 2-flat converted to an apartment on the second floor and art studio on the first floor in the Historic Pullman neighborhood in Chicago, IL. I have a small organic food garden in the back and love to cook/prepare; raw, vegan/vegetarian, organic/healthy/gourmet - I'm not obliged to any specific diet so I enjoy lots of different foods and flavors. I try and learn one new thing a year - last year it was learning restoration of 1880's slate roof/facades with a craftsman and architect friends. This year, bringing artists to Pullman and Pullman to artists. Next, maybe exploring more permaculture ideas/trends.  

I have an absolutely lovely girlfriend who travels with me whenever possible (Amy). She is a social delight and has a wonderful way with people/cultures (like insisting on learning/speaking Spanish when we explored Spain). She offers a genuine ease with meeting new people and a welcoming charm. You'll like her.

Looking forward to meeting you...

-jb

name: Cozy & comfy with AC close to California Blue Line
description:
Comfortable accommodations near the California Blue Line; a cozy climate controlled room and shared bath with everything you'd need for a great visit to work or sightsee; Close to coffee, food and drink and all that Logan Square has to offer.

Before a request to book please have a COMPLETE profile. "Hey I'm so and so" with nothing else about you is considered incomplete; I prefer some details about you and your visit and recommendations/reviews of past trips as well would be ideal. Thank you!

The space
Full size memory foam bed which is wonderfully comfortable for one person, an Eames compact sofa, TV with ROKU (stream Netflix) in the room, wireless internet, reading light and a very nice outdoor deck and garden for lounging, as well as a place to do a load of laundry if the need arises.

It's close to blue line CALIFORNIA el stop to O'hare or downtown, the Fullerton bus (straight to Lincoln Park) and the California Av. bus stops are close
neighborhood_overview: It's continually evolving and many people out walking, riding, with dogs, kids, strollers and many options for restaurants, lots of green space and trees.  Logan Square has won Best Neighborhood (contest) on Curbed (it's a national real estate website) and now they are calling it the Craft Cocktail capital of Chicago as well.
host_about:
I've lived in Logan Square since 1999, Wicker Park and Bucktown since 1988.  Some people call us 'old timers', some just say old...or maybe pioneers?  
My point is I know this area well and I love my city.  I've seen countless live bands here in Chicago, all kinds of genres. I've worked in the music scene and I know lots about what to do in Chicago and don't mind pointing you in the right direction for anything from shopping to entertainment, thrift stores, food, culture, acupuncture, spas, etc. I may even give you a ride there if I am not doing anything else that day.  

I thrive on art, music, architecture and designing my little house for the enjoyment of myself and my guests. I am pretty much always working on some project here (in my head or literally). I would say I am not a mainstream person and thus pretty open minded.  I am looking forward to meeting some fellow travelers and giving them a soft place to land for a few days!  I've really enjoyed meeting some guests already and look forward to more!  

I also enjoy traveling (often alone) and consider myself an outstanding and thoughtful guest, and generally pretty low maintenance. Having hosted myself, I try to always leave my space clean and fully respect all the house rules.

Shoppin

name: Logan Square Classic Bungalow
description:
Get to know Chicago by jumping off from a Classic Logan Square Bungalow. My 100+ year old home is a great place to explore the city from the coolest neighborhood in town. And I will give you tips to see/ do/ eat the best Chicago has to offer.

The space
The house was built in 1908 and has all of the charm of an old home, but with all of the modern conveniences of today (wireless internet, AC, television, etc). The guest room is comfortable with a double bed, dresser, mirror, ceiling fan, a window air conditioning unit (summer months only), two chairs, cd player, record player (on request) and a storage rack for hanging clothes. I provide current issues of the Chicago Reader for the curious traveler. There is a washer/ dryer in the basement and a kitchen is available. The kitchen was completely remodeled in September 2011 and was voted as a finalist in the 2012 Richard H. Driehaus Foundation Awards presented by the Historic Chicago Bungalow Association. The
neighborhood_overview: My place is located in the greatest part of Logan Square.  Logan Square is a dynamic neighborhood where tons of great things happen.  Short walks to the Centennial Monument, Lula Cafe, The Logan Square Farmers Markets (summer and winter), Longman and Eagle, The Owl, Palmer Square, Wolfbait and B Girls, Estereo, Hopewell Brewing, The Logan Square Auditorium, Daisey, The Congress Theater, Revolution Brewing, Boulevard Bike Shop, The Rocking Horse, The Whistler, shopping, art, parks and everything else Logan Square has to offer.
host_about: I am a proud resident of the Logan Square community (since 2000) and the city of Chicago (since 1995).  As an avid traveler I love getting insider tips from locals.  As a host on Air BnB, I love giving great tips to guests.  Other interests include- travel, food, live music, urban hiking, Cubs baseball, drinking good coffee, welding, craft wine/ beer, reading, biking.

name: Spacious, Vintage Hyde Park Apt.
description:
The space
Our apartment is a third floor walk up in a lovely 1910 condo. The room is spacious, light, and quiet with an en suite bathroom. A ceiling fan and window AC are available for warm weather. The neighborhood is tree-lined and beautiful. It is a short walk to public transportation that will take you downtown in 15 minutes (the Metra train, and the#6 and #2 Express buses to the Loop). And we are a 5 minute walk from the lakefront bike and running path and several beaches. There are city rental bikes available on the way to the bike path. Hyde Park is the home of the University of Chicago,the Museum of Science and Industry, the Court Theater, the Smart Gallery, the Renaissance Gallery, and the Hyde Park Art Center, as well as President Obama’s residence. We are located about a mile from the University campus. Plenty of street parking is available near the apartment.. There are a variety of restaurants and cafes in walking distance.

As your hosts we will m
host_about: I am a photographer and my husband is a writer.  We have lived in Hyde Park for 35 years and raised two children here.  We run, bike, and swim with our two labs, Ella and Finn, and love to hike.  We have lived in this apartment for 17 years and did extensive rehab. We garden in a community garden in the neighborhood and do a lot of cooking.

The space
****Wrigleyville Loft 3 blocks way from Wrigley field****

-------------------------------

If you are thinking about staying in a Chicago Hotel....DON'T!!
"ala" David Letterman....Here are the TOP REASONS why you should stay at our Chicago Loft

1. FREE PARKING: Most Chicago hotels are now charging $65 PER NIGHT to park a car. We have two secure parking spots included in the price!
2. HUGE SPACE: The loft can accomodate 4 people, each couple in their own bedroom and using their own bathroom. No need to worry about sharing a tiny room with double beds and using the same bathroom....
3. GOURMET KITCHEN... fully stocked.
4. FREE WIFI: Chicago hotels can charge up to $20 a da
neighborhood_overview: Located in Wrigleyville, a small area of the Lake View neighborhood, the loft is just four blocks from historic Wrigley Field and one block from the Brown-line/Red-line "L" stop. Restaurants and theaters are within a seven-block radius.
host_about: After living in this beautiful city for 21 years,  we have discovered some unique places- We  think you will find it as amazing as we do, regardless of the season. Even in winter! Our loft  is a GEM in the heart of the city!   If you are new to Chicago, We can provide suggestions of all of our favorite places to visit, dine, booze and see, both on and off the beaten path.

name: Eclectic West Town 2BR w/ Vintage Charm
description:
This sunny West Town 2BR is a perfect place to call home after a day of exploring Chicago. Located on the top floor of a 3rd floor walk-up on a quiet residential street, just a few blocks away from bars, shops and restaurants.

The space
This apt is on the 3rd floor in the rear of building away from the street, so incredibly quiet and peaceful with tons of natural sunlight. High ceilings, large windows, vintage furnishings, open floor plan with two bedrooms, one off the kitchen with a twin bed and 2nd bedroom off of the living room with a queen bed. The apt can fit up to 3 people with 2 on the queen and 1 on the twin. There is an air mattress that fits in either twin room or living room should you need it.
***NOTE: This is a prewar building, circa 1910 construction. Recent renovations have taken place, but the building and apt DO maintain their "vintage charm". Please advise if you are used to hotel stays or modern apartments. Think bicycle wheel pot-holder
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet residential neighborhood, tucked a few blocks in on each side from 4 exciting main drags. Chicago ave a mere 3 blocks away has lots of great restaurants, bars, a homemade pie shop, library, walgreens, taco joints, boutiques etc . I've lived here 4 years after living in 3 other neighborhoods and it's by far my favorite. Very close to downtown and remarkably easy to get around via the bus system on all the main roads nearby.
host_about:
Nice to meet you! I've been hosting in Chicago for the past 6 years and NYC for the past 2. I truly love opening my spaces to guests, and am always on hand for recommendations, a cup of coffee, or a chat. 

I'm a writer, actor, and professional organizer by trade(s). If you rent my place in NYC I'm sure we'll meet, if you rent in Chicago you'll meet my lovely co-host Kelsey. I'm a big traveler myself, some favorite destinations being Turkey, Berlin, Cuba, New Orleans, Montreal and Cambodia! 

Look forward to meeting you

name: Large, Private Logan Square Studio
description:
Your hideout in the City! Cozy, large garden apartment with exposed brick, comfortable amenities and a fun vibe. Completely private and a perfect, no-nonsense place to relax after enjoying the city and the electric Logan Square / Bucktown area.

The space
Private, modern studio garden apartment in Logan Square. Features and amenities include:

- 650 square feet (60 m²)
- Minutes from the CTA Blue Line and ample nightlife
- Well-lit modern interior with modest natural light, cool exposed brick
- Large modern bathroom with large shower, sink, toilet and vanity
- Galley kitchen with microwave, fridge, gas oven / range, electric hot water kettle, coffee maker and kitchen basics (plates, cups, knives, forks and basic pots and pans & utensils)
- Queen size bed that sleeps two (medium firm mattress)
- Convertible futon / sofa bed that sleeps two, extra bedding provided
- Central heating and air conditioning along with a spa
neighborhood_overview:
- Logan Square is an electric, eccentric mix of different ethnicities, families and young professionals. It if frequently named one of America's hippest neighborhoods.

- There is something for everyone; great award winning restaurants, bars, live music, street festivals, parks, a great farmers market and cool local boutiques. There are many spots within a five minute walk including historic Logan Boulevard and the hot Milwaukee Avenue Corridor

- The neighborhood is a food buff and night owl's paradise
host_about: Hello everyone!  I'm Jonathan and I'm an avid traveler.  Myself along with Amanda and Bob have hosted on Airbnb since its introduction in Chicago.  We are proud of our city and our apartments and really want you to have a fabulous time during your stay with us.  We have attempted to create an easy low-key guest experience that really helps you feel like a local while providing the best bang for your buck.  I hope we have achieved it!

name: Private Lincoln Square Garden Apt
description:
Clean and comfortable one-bedroom garden apartment with kitchenette in a vintage brick building. Sleeps 2-4 comfortably (queen bed and futon or air mattress). Pleasant and lively neighborhood and a short walk to the train.

The space
Garden apartment with private entry, one large bedroom, full bathroom, and kitchenette (microwave, coffee maker, toaster, mini-fridge, but no stove). Very fun and walkable neighborhood. Old Town School of Folk Music, Lincoln Square shopping/restaurants, grocery store, nearby train and bike sharing stations, parks, and more. We adhere to the Airbnb cleaning protocol and a minimum of 24 hours between guest stays.

There is no central air conditioning, but the apartment generally stays cool in warm weather; however, we do provide a portable air conditioner for the hot months. Of interest to families with youngsters, there is a little play area and toys under the stairs (Kids love it), a fun tree swing out front in the parkway
neighborhood_overview:
In our humble opinion, this is one of the best neighborhoods in Chicago. It's lively, fun and one of the safest in the city.

Within three blocks we have: independent coffee shop, an L station, Harvestime (eclectic, independent grocery store), bike/walking path along Chicago River, Bloom Yoga studio. Within 6-8 blocks: River Park w/ public pool, Waters School (w/natural prairie and community gardens). There's almost always something happening in Lincoln Square; check out the Chamber of Commerce events calendar online (sorry, can't provide links here.)

A note about crime and safety: The shootings in Chicago are concentrated in the south and west side neighborhoods; it can and does happen in all neighborhoods, but victims are almost always gang-involved. Situational awareness is always advised. We have never had any guests raise safety concerns, but we do want to help if you have any.
host_about: My family of four lives in the top unit of the two-flat. We spend a lot of time walking or biking around in our neighborhood (we happily have no car). You can often find us out front, sitting on the bench, swinging  from the tree, or just chatting with neighbors. We love visiting other cities where we can stay in interesting neighborhoods without the hassle of needing a car. We think our place is well-suited for others  who appreciate urban neighborhoods.

name: Groovy on the Lake  private bd/bth
description:
Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. Magical bedroom w full bath can sleep three. Perfect for kids, lovely for grownups, too. Promise, it's all good.

The space
Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour door staff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. Whip-up breakfast in a yarn-wrapped kitchen under a disco ball, and then settle down to eat on a rosewood table under a turn of the century chandelier. Super swank pad of electric blues, chocolate brown, and an orange so vibrant it almost pulsates. Because the universe is kind, we're a show-house for the Jennifer Norback gallery, so brace yourself for some insanely cool art. The place has a good vibe. <
neighborhood_overview: East Lakeview/Boystown is eclectic neighborhood is a vibrant mix of hipsters, families, socialites, buskers, orthodox Jews, and gays, with just enough heart and grit to make you feel good about living in the city. Plus, we have the best gelato, cupcakes, falafel and fried Korean chicken in Chicago, hands-down.
host_about: author + artist + social entrepreneur + community activist.

name: Logan Square Modern Vintage Garden
description:
This two-bedroom, cozy ground-level flat with a newly renovated bathroom is a great base from which to explore Logan Square's restaurants, coffee houses and farmers market. It's a perfect point of departure for Chicago's sites and attractions.

The space
:: Hi there and welcome to my listing! ::

It's my eighth year of being an AirBNB host, and I can't wait to share Chicago with you! A newly renovated bathroom and full kitchen await you, and the Logan Square neighborhood just keeps getting better and better. Get yourself over here!

:: Important basics ::
- Accommodates four people maximum, but can be COZY for four adults.
- In summer, a window unit air conditioner cools the place down.
- Yes, towels are provided.
- No dishwasher.
- No pets. No exceptions.
- On-street PARKING is easily available and free (it requires a neighborhood permit which is provided).
- Again, it is an English Garden apartment AT GROUN
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in Logan Square. It's one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, boasting gorgeous boulevards. Family-friendly amenities are balanced by a thriving nightlife scene with cocktail bars, gastropubs, late night eateries and live music.
host_about:
Midwestern urban farm girl who appreciates art, architecture, travel, good food and good friends. I wear many hats, among them interior decorator, writer, corporate marketing veteran, vintage/antique dealer and landlord. I've owned my Logan Square property for more than 11 years and have lived in Chicago on and off for the last 25 with a stint in Washington, DC. I am excited to welcome fellow travelers who like to explore "off the beaten path" and proud to welcome them into my home, which is my pride and joy.  

My personal recent travels include a long weekend in Detroit, some great hiking in Park City, Utah, a very long break on Kauai and some urban fun in NYC.

name: Chicago Lakefront Sailing Yacht
description:
Enjoy our beautiful Beneteau 36 foot sailing yacht on the dock of Chicago's lakefront. Swim off the boat in Lake Michigan. Two private staterooms, easily sleeps 4 plus. Hot water, heat, air conditioning, TV, high speed internet.

The space
Beautiful 36-foot Beneteau sailing yacht located April thru mid-November on the dock at Burnham Harbor, next to Soldier Field in the fabulous Chicago Museum Campus. Convenient parking (free for one car). Complete comfort with central air, full bath with hot water shower, full galley with microwave, fridge, oven, stove, gas grill. Flat screen wifi TV. High speed WIFI.

Stunning views of the cityscape and summer fireworks. Location is steps from the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Planetarium, Grant Park, Pritzker Pavilion, Buckingham Fountain, Soldier Field. Perfect for Chicago Bears games and concerts at FirstMerit Bank Pavilion at Northerly Island, or McCormick Place events. World class restaurants, theaters,
host_about: I'm an outgoing family man who, along with my wife, would love to host you in our backyard garden treehouse which I built with help from a buddy.  I'm a  coast guard licensed sailor who took a few years off to sail the Caribbean.  I do carpentry, and in my spare time I am currently helping to develop an eco treehouse lodge on the Snake River in the Teton foothills near Jackson Hole, Wyoming.  I also enjoy gardening.  We are a multi-racial open-minded household so people of all races and lifestyles are welcome here.

name: Home Away From Home
description:
The space
Are You Looking For An Affordable Place To Stay While Visiting The Windy City for Business or Pleasure or Perhaps Both? Look no further...

Located in Chicago's Historic Bronzeville District you will find and be able to enjoy the splendor and exotic enchantment of this cozy and spacious one-bedroom condo/apartment with a contemporary feel and old world charm while staying within your budget.

Bedroom & Bathroom:
Comfortable poster queen-size bed sleeps two and a
sofa-bed for an additional guest in living room. Bed
linens are provided; towels, wash rags and toiletries
are located in the bathroom for you to use.

Kitchen & Pantry:
Include microwave, stove, refrigerator, dishwasher,
coffee maker, electric kettle, and toaster. You are free to
use them.

Living Room:
neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of one of Chicago's oldest historic districts with gorgeous brown/gray stone houses and mansions. Its is also  0.6-miles from the lake or approximately 10-20 minutes walk depending on your pace. There are trails along the lake for running, biking or just strolling. And of course there is a marina and beach nearby on 31st and Oakwood  It is also the home of Chicago's Famous Chicken & Waffle Restaurant.

name: Spacious Bedroom, steps to El train
description:
Very private room at Montrose Brown line El stop. (map that to see if it’s your ideal area) in a VERY spacious and lovely home. Easy street parking, or parking spot available for a fee! Seconds from bus! Downtown in 22 minutes! Early/late check-in/out available. LGBTQ welcoming.

The train is nearby so I have earplugs for you if you’re not used to the city sounds :)

The space
It has a fun artsy feel, is beautifully decorated, and is always described by guests as very peaceful!

Keep in mind that it's a 3BR apt. I stay in my den if all 3 rooms are full. **Must be okay with the other rooms being rented out** (even though it’s rare that I have separate parties occupying my apartment) and sharing bathroom as well. It is a shared space, not a private apt :)

Because of a dozen past experiences: I have stopped allowing guests to drink in my home. Also, no additional guests inside my home aside from the ones listed on the reservation.

I (Tracy) used to be a photographer but decided to change careers and become a Mortician.  Josue is a Socialite, Traveller, Humanitarian, Activist, Producer and Investor. We love everything we do and hosting for Airbnb is definitely one of them.  When our guests are happy we are happy. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable and amazing as possible. Josue is great with directions, places to check out, things to do, events and nightlife. He knows how to make an awesome drink as well! I love to cook and try new recipes. We both like to go out and experience nightlife, love being foodies and trying out new restaurants when the time permits. Love to travel as well, but Chicago is our Home for now! We are happy to share the experience!

name: Stylish, comfortable room in nice Duplex
description:
The Airbnb room was just completely renovated, new flooring, paint, furniture and bedding :)

The space
Great neighborhood !! West Lakeview, a very safe neighborhood on the Northside of Chicago. Just a two minute walk to Hamlin Park and 5 minutes to Roscoe Village, known for its restaurants, shops and coffee shops.
On the corner of either the Damen (N/S) or Diversey (E/W) bus lines. 15 min car ride to downtown Chicago.

My preferred guests for my Airbnb guest room on the garden level of my duplex apartment are college students, professionals and tourists.
The room dimensions are 11x12". You will have a full private closet and a full private bathroom at your disposal right next to your room, also a private entrance that leads straight to your room.

The apartment is new, modern yet comfortable in design. There's an entrance on each level for added privacy so we aren't constantly walking through each others' lives.

The ava
host_about:
I am a work-at-home mom with three children of which two are already out of college. The youngest, my 19 year old son just started college. 
I love music, art and most of what Chicago's urban culture has to offer.

My Airbnb registration no is : R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

name: The Stained Glass Apt. Edgewater #1
description:
The space
*Attention to first time users of Airbnb* This is not a private apartment for rent. I live here and I also have another smaller room listed on the site! My apartment is on the third floor of a three flat brick building on a quiet tree lined street in Edgewater. It was built 1916 in Prairie style featuring high ceilings, amazing woodwork and stained glass all of which have been restored. I'm a big fan of flea markets and antique stores so my home is filled with beautiful curiosities. My friend calls it "The museum" but don't let that scare you :) The place has a really comfy and peaceful vibe. It is spacious and open in the way that one can stand at one end of the apartment and see through to the other end. There is an enclosed sunporch in the front of the house which offers a serene view of the tops of trees. The bedroom I can offer has a comfortable double bed and a most prized Eastlake antique dresser with egyptian pharaoh head drawer pulls. There is one shared
neighborhood_overview: The location is really prime as it's approximately a 4 1/2 block walk (roughly 8 minutes) to either Granville or Loyola redline train stations as well as 6 blocks to the lake. The neighborhood is really lovely and down right lush with trees and flowers (when weather permits)  Although Edgewater is a 30-45 minute train ride downtown, there is something to be said for staying here and getting a taste of a real Chicago neighborhood. Staying downtown is great in many ways but it is the typical tourist view and you will not experience  what I consider to be the real heart of Chicago where the regular folks live. There are two antique malls, a couple of great coffee houses and restaurants all a short walk away.
host_about:
I am currently on a new path=which really means I lost my job and I want to try something different. I have done quite a bit of international travel and hope to do a lot more. I love people. I am an artist, card maker and writer. I am obsessed with postcards. I'm really in love with Chicago and although I've lived here my whole life I continue to discover new treasure!

Some things that I love: Writing, reading, bicycling, coffee, trying different types of food, yoga, movies, old cemeteries, art museums, photography, vintage postcards, pen pals, architecture, antique markets, folk art, tiles, decorative metal, wine, beer, and a well crafted cocktail and of course,  traveling!!!

I believe good things can come from seemingly bad things: the symbolic opening of a new door. 

I strive to be present, recognize beauty, project love, and be extremely grateful for my life.  Each person I meet reinforces my belief in a world full of love and kindness and every new friend makes it a better place.  Traveling has been my most valuable education. 

Places I have traveled: Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, England, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Kenya, Mexico, Monaco, Morocco, Netherlands, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Scotland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, Wales

name: Designer Lakeview Haven. Private Rooftop Oasis!
description:
Beautiful 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath condo on tree lined street in charming Lakeview. Only a 2 minute walk to the Paulina Brown line stop and 20 minute walk to Wrigley Field, I’m nestled between the Southport Corridor and Roscoe Village. Short walk to Starbucks, Target, Walgreens, Whole Foods and multiple restaurants and bars. Hop on the train and be downtown in 20 minutes. I have 3 floors of bright and spacious living with a gorgeous furnished rooftop with city views.

The space
This is my dream home. My condo has 3 floors of living space with the main floor offering a bright and open living room, dining room, kitchen and two balconies. The second floor consists of 2 master suits with en suite bathrooms. One of the suites has a private balcony. My private rooftop offers an entire outdoor living space with city views.

I have Amazon Echo and Netflix in the Living Room for your entertainment. My Amazon Music subscription will play any type of background music yo
neighborhood_overview:
My condo is in the heart of Lakeview, the most comfortable neighborhood in Chicago.

I live within one block of the Paulina brown line train stop, Starbucks, City Target, Frasca Italian Restaurant, Fernando’s Mexican Restaurant, Brown Bag Seafood and Waterhouse Bar and Grill. This neighborhood is VERY safe!

Southport Corridor- (bars, restaurants, J-Crew, Gap, Bonobos, Soul Cycle, boutique shopping)- 10 minute walk
Roscoe Village (bars, restaurants, boutiques)- 5 minute walk
Wrigley Field- 20 minute walk
Boystown- 20 minute walk
host_about: I’m a Chicago based Luxury Travel Advisor spending half of my time working remotely and traveling throughout the world. I “retired” from my 15 year corporate career to travel the world and never stopped.

name: 3 Bedroom Apartment in Historic Wicker Park Home
description:
This spacious 3-bedroom apartment is on the main level of a historic home just blocks away from popular restaurants, bars, shops and cafes. The apartment features a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, and laundry. Perfect for a group getaway!

The space
Our spacious 3-bedroom apartment includes a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, washer/dryer and dish washer. Enjoy staying in a premier neighborhood just blocks away from all the action! We're also just minutes away from downtown, United Center and Wrigley Field.

Guest access
This spacious apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private.

Other things to note
We offer secure parking and a full breakfast each morning at the B&B. Ask about adding these amenities to your reservation for an additional fee.

License number
2217003
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is a thriving community full of restaurants, bars, shops, and cafes along with beautiful historic and newly-remodeled homes on quiet tree-lined streets.  Just minutes away from downtown, guests can easily experience Chicago attractions or catch a game at Wrigley Field or a show at the United Center.  The apartment is centrally located and close to many popular spots in Chicago.  Come stay and live like a local!
host_about:
Thank you for your interest in the Wicker Park Inn!  We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors.  We are honored to be considered a second home for many visiting family and friends in the neighborhood.

I've lived in the Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood over 15 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes.  There is always a new restaurant opening while old favorites just get better with time.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University.  I started running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004.  Over the years, we've updated and expanded the Wicker Park Inn which now includes four guestrooms and three apartments.  We are staffed with amazing innkeepers, Robin and Emily, and our impeccable cleaning staff.

We look forward to hosting your stay!

name: Edgebrook Lg bdr by golf course
description:
Beautiful private bedroom (1 of 2) in a ranch style home, you have full access to everything on the ground floor including living room, kitchen, and bathroom (shared if there is a tenant in the second bedroom). During the Covid crisis, there will be only one room rented at a time as to keep exposure to others at a minimum. I live in the basement level and have my own space and will only share the kitchen with you.

The space
Stay in one of two bedrooms in a quiet, upscale Edgebrook house across from the Billy Caldwell public golf course. This is larger bedroom of the two and is furnished with a queen size bed with a desk and large close space, great for extended stay or just a short visit or a few days of golf across the street. There is ample street parking and two parking ports available for your use. I occupy the lower floor of the home and we will share the kitchen.

There is one bathroom for the two rooms for rent and you will have to share it
host_about:
I am a professional violinist, small business owner, and a lover of all things creative.  I've traveled to Europe, Middle East, Russia, Mexico, and  to 49 states and love meeting people from different cultures. 

Originally from Taiwan, I grew up in Seattle and moved to Chicago in 1995 and have been here ever since.  I know the ins and outs of Chicago and can point you to some of the best things to see around the city and some of the out of the way places only locals know.  I am very easy going and love to entertain so you'll be sure to have a pleasant and fun stay while you are in town.

name: Bedrm/Bath - Swanky Northside Condo.
description:
A combination of home-style generosity and orderly AirBnB protocols will welcome you to the Far North Side with Michael and Rox.

The space
Attractively appointed ground-floor bedroom and bathroom are all yours in a large new condo owned and occupied by a playful couple -- a freelance professional (journalist/professor/former concierge) and her well-read husband Michael.

FREE wifi, satellite TV (in room), laundry in unit, street parking. Great for persons using a car or those willing to take a bus a few minutes' walk from the house to get to a variety of trains/buses, or walk one mile to numerous transport lines going south to downtown or north to the North Shore suburbs. Use of kitchen and great room would be shared with hosts.

Central a/c and heat. Target store with full grocery 1/2 block away. Richly cultural Pakistani/Indian commercial strip a short walk away on Devon Avenue. The place is actually NOT in Rogers Park technically and d
neighborhood_overview: This sleepy tree-lined area near Lake Michigan is 1/2 block from Target (with Starbuck's within).  Another mile puts you in trendy Andersonville, Edgewater and Rogers Park, or even closer to the north, Devon Avenue for Pakistani/Indian fare and shopping.  Due east is Lake Michigan with the CTA Red Line running constantly to downtown through many fun areas along the way: Uptown, Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lakeview and Lincoln Park.  It's a 10-minute bus or taxi ride through a mostly residential area to the Red Line station in bustling Edgewater.  You can also pick up a Divvy bike at the Target 1/2 block from the house and ride to the nearest CTA Red Line station (Bryn Mawr) docking the bike near there.  Walking to the Red Line takes about 20 minutes.  Suburban Chicago is a short drive away -- Lincolnwood and Skokie to the west and Evanston to the north.
host_about: Performer/Professor/Journalist/Former Chicago Concierge from New Orleans living in Chicago for 30 years.  Lived in France and the Middle East.  (Tried several different profile pictures that weren't uploading, then discovered they ALL uploaded. Now there's an album in there! And I look like I live with a drink in my hand!  I do have fun.  But can't drink much!) Husband Michael is a legal analyst.

name: 2 BD Condo by downtown,park,lake
description:
Awesome location, amazingly clean, below pricing for the area. You will not want to spend time in the apartment when you are so close to Chicago's famous sights, dining, and nightlife.

The space
This is an extremely clean 2 Bedroom condo with a quiet courtyard to relax in. We are close to Downtown shopping, Lincoln Park, and North Ave beach. You can walk to public transportation and restaurants. It is minutes to Chicago's famous Rush street, Magnificent Mile, and Lincoln Park Zoo. It is a favorite of young professionals. For those with a car, the Interstate is less than a mile away. Travel times to the airports are 20 minutes for Midway and 35 minutes O'Hare. Allow extra time for rush hour.

There are two bedrooms each with a comfortable Queen bed, a living room with fireplace, cable TV, and wireless Internet, a dining room, and a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, stove, dishwasher, microwave, toaster oven, cooking utensils, and dishes). Every room
neighborhood_overview: This is a very active neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, shopping, night life, and places to visit. All are within walking distance or a short ride by public transportation.
host_about:
For exercise I run Marathons, Ski, and Scuba. For business, I buy and sell Real Estate. For music, I totally enjoy Bruce Springsteen.
I value family and friends to the highest degree. As a Rotarian, community service is very important. I serve as a Board member of Arc of Hope, a Board member of Evanston Lighthouse Rotary, and a member of the Skokie Chamber of Commerce

Located in a classic Lakeview building, this new redecorated studio is larger than most in the neighborhood and has space for a sleeping area and living area in the main space. There is a separate kitchen space to cook and enjoy meals in as well.

name: Palmer Treehouse - Bedroom 2
description:
Affordable in excellent Logan Sq location

The space
Cozy, beautiful, unique and rustic, this apartment overlooks and English style park in Logan Square. This apartment is not for everyone. Although it is beautiful, cozy, with comfortable beds, couches, etc - it is NOT a modern building...those with cat allergies, or who are very sensitive to the normal degree of dust in Victorian buildings will likely not be happy here. That said, we do try to keep things clean with regular dusting and an air purifier. A beautiful old greystone built in 1871, with an interesting history, and very characteristic of Chicago’s unique architectural trends of the era. If you have interest in older architecture, provided you do not have serious cat allergies, you will likely feel right at home. It's a great combo of vintage and new - especially on the 3rd floor, which is a little more updated. This listing includes the Palmer Oasis, which is one floor up. If you have a strong preferen
neighborhood_overview:
Logan sq has some of the best cuisine in Chicago, some would say the country! So if you are into eating like that, you will never have to leave the neighborhood.
It's also easy to rent bikes in Logan square, if you'd like to travel in a leisurely way around the neighborhood and city.
host_about:
I have been hosting on Airbnb for nearly a decade, and I love the opportunities to meet and connect with new people it brings. I travel frequently for work, but have enjoyed calling Chicago my home base for most of my life.  My roots in the neighborhood (Logan sq) go back generations; great grandparents on both sides (as well as one great-great grandmother!) lived and raised their families here, so the neighborhood history and its many changes and configurations are a personally fascinating subject to me. Sharing my favorite things about this uniquely down to earth and culturally diverse city is a passion of mine! 
I’m grateful that Airbnb allows me the privilege of connecting with other interesting/ interested travelers.

name: Logan Square-Chicago Prime Location-Longer Stays
description:
This is a house size apartment in a prime location in Logan Square, spacious and nicely furnished with just what you need, no more. Families and travelers from around the world have stayed here. Available for longer stays (min one month) in 2018. The den can be converted to a bedroom, we have hosted groups up to six people. Very convenient for travelers, short walk to Blue Line Train (O'Hare and Downtown). Our unit is ready to move in and enjoy Chicago. Great for families.

The space
Logan Square is a "hot" neighborhood in Chicago - lots of young people, new business and entertainment, excellent transportation central to CTA train, major highways, bike routes, and airport. This apartment is ideal for a couple or family, short term stay or transition move. Our unit is on one of the nicest blocks, with quiet "residential neighborhood" vibe but very short walk to cool coffee shops, boutique grocers and wine shop, top notch restaurants including Longman and Ea
neighborhood_overview: Spacious but bustling urban neighborhood in a great city.  Surprisingly easy to park.  There are city rental bikes ("Divvy" bikes) only a half block away on Altgeld, next to Quiote Restaurant.  Its a three block walk to the train, and we are less than half mile from a second train stop as well.
host_about: We live in the residence with our two preteen children. The neighborhood is bustling. Eat and drink at any of  several excellent establishments just a few steps away. We love our neighborhood and you will too.

name: Lovely 2 bedroom in Lincoln Square
description:
This spacious light garden (lower level )unit is 2 BR & is great for singles & families traveling. It's child friendly with a pack & play & high chair. There are 2 BR & a 20" high airbed for extra guests. Near a park, shops restaurants, CTA trains. The unit is cleaned and sanitized according to Airbnb’s 5-step enhanced cleaning process

The space
Beautiful spacious unit near Foster and Damen on the North Side of Chicago.
•2 bedrooms
•Full modern kitchen
•Wireless internet
•Premium cable
•Parking Included
•Laundry Access

The garden level unit is a large open space approximately 1000 square feet on the garden ( basement) level of a classic Chicago brick condominium building. The garden level floor was recently dug down to allow for extra space and has a new floor with cherrywood flooring. The space is totally green and energy efficient with new heating and air conditioning system for the building. I live on the 1st f
neighborhood_overview:
The Neighborhood

Lincoln Square is a, vibrant neighborhood with many shops, eateries, bars and cafes. The Historic "El" Train Line has 2 conveniently located stops (on the Brown Line) in Lincoln Sq. if you wish to explore the shops of downtown Chicago or take in a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. There is easy access to the lakefront just 2 miles east for an impressive ride along Lake Michigan. Check out Lincoln Square's antique shops, many different ethnic restaurants, theater groups, or the concert schedule at the famous "Old Town School of Folk Music" for upcoming performances. I leave a current copy of the Reader which has the week’s events listed.

Bowmansville is a neighborhood within Lincoln Square community and is also close to Andersonville which is a Swedish neighborhood top rated Chicago stop filled with restaurants, shops, the Swedish Museum, Women and Children's Bookstore and much more. The unit's major cross streets closet too are Admen and Foster. Th
host_about:
My name is Janet and I am a native Chicagoan and know the the city well. I work as a Licensed Clinical Psychologist in a Private Alternative Health Practice, teach, research and also serve as a consultant to our state government .  I am also interested in studying energy in groups and social systems both here and abroad. I like alternative medicine, meditation, art, theater ,good food  and also to hang out with friends. During weekdays, I am hardly ever at home,often only to sleep.  I am open-minded and very sociable and if you are interested in learning about the city and restaurants and sights to see, I can be a valuable resource.  If you have any question or need further information please contact me I will be pleased to answer you.  It is helpful to know something about you and the reason for your visit to Chicago.   There are some guests that are here for the first time and are interested in local restaurants, ideas of current activities in Chicago while others are here visiting family and friends and want only minimum contact. 

The unit is separate and has its own temperature system and I am not readily available in the building as I am working.  So you will have access to me via texts and there are a list of emergency contacts within a few minutes of the building.  We like to make your stay as comfortable as we can..  
Warm regards,  
Janet

name: 3 Bedroom Victorian Beauty at Logan Square
description:
This is a wonderful, bright, very clean and modern apartment located at the second floor of a beautiful Victorian corner building, available for one up to three guests or families with children.

The space
The apartment is 1,200 square feet with huge windows all around with wooden blinds, gorgeous hardwood floors and beautiful original woodwork.

The first bedroom includes a queen bed, the second bedroom is kids friendly with a bunk bed (queen+twin) which however is still extremely comfortable for adult use, and the third bedroom has a twin bed and a desk.

The new modern hickory kitchen has plenty of cabinet space and everything you need for home cooking. Includes among others dishwasher, combo washer/dryer, blender, Nespresso coffee maker, milk frother for your cappuccino's and lattes and others.

Other amenities include central A/C, private deck, microwave, new smart wifi TV and Apple TV for Netflix.

During the spring an
neighborhood_overview:
Logan Square is an official community area, historical neighborhood, and public square located on the northwest side of the City of Chicago. The Logan Square neighborhood, located within the Logan Square community area, is centered on the public square that serves as its namesake, located at the three-way intersection of Milwaukee Avenue, Logan Boulevard and Kedzie Boulevard. The area is characterized by the prominent historical boulevards, stately greystones and large bungalow-style homes.

The neighborhood, one of the most trendy ones in Chicago these days, has the highest concentration of new Michelin recommended restaurants.

Excellent restaurants are all within walking distance including: The Telegraph (Wine Bar - excellent ambience and food, rare selection of wines), Lula Cafe (probably the best brunch place in Chicago), Wasabi (Japanese - the best ramen soup in Chicago), Longman and Eagle (American), Revolution (Brewery), Bristol (American) and many others.
host_about: Finance professional. Loves international travel.
