name: Comfy Room & Bike in Roscoe Village
description:
Check out our 2 bedroom entire apartment upstairs listing if you are interested in sleeping more than two people! Can actually accommodate up to 9!!! https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2837146

The space
Love your stay in Chicago- private bedroom with private bath right across the hall, bathtub/shower. Bed is quite comfortable and can be converted into either a single or king. We also have an air mattress or comfy couch if an additional bed is needed. There is plenty of closet space.

Check out our new 2 bedroom entire home/apt upstairs listing if you are interested in separate bedrooms or for sleeping more than two people! It will actually accommodate up to 7!!! Available starting in June 2014 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2837146

The kitchen is open to use with complimentary coffee and light snacks as is free washer/dryer and 10Mb/sec wireless internet. Backyard has spacious deck and nice lawn area, BBQ also if needed, smoking allowed in backyard,
neighborhood_overview: There is a specialty beer and wine shop about 5 doors down, a great local watering hole right up the street and two blocks away Roscoe Village has plenty of food choices- good pub, pizza, sushi, American, Guatemalan, Italian, Mexican, sandwiches- you name it. We have two major super markets about a half mile away and a Trader Joes and Whole Foods that are only about a mile away. There are endless food and drink choices less than one mile in any direction. Happy to guide you to the fun spots.
host_about:
Professional circus performer married to a pediatrician who is an award winning yarny (crochet). We lived in Chicago for 17 years where we were Airbnb Superhosts for 10 years but have since moved back home to San Jose, CA where we now share our homestead/farm with travelers. 

We love to see the world. I'm a home brewer, SCUBA diver, hang glider pilot and sourdough bread baker. We always enjoy sharing our animals and hobbies with our guests!

name: Guest bedroom with private bath
description:
The space
Italian style beautiful apartment filled with art in Chicago Uptown.
The room is part of an elegant 2 bedrooms 2 baths apartment, includes a very large master bedroom with huge walking closet and marble baths with double vanity and jacuzzi tub and a big guest bedroom with private marble bathroom with tub. Exceptionally big full kitchen with french doors to patio and large living room with fireplace. Washer and dryer in the unit.
Walking distance (3 blocks) to redline subway trains take you straight to downtown or the North portion of Chicago and Evanston.
The eclectic neighborhood has all you need within walking distance, including coffee shops (Starbucks), artisan bakeries, and food reflecting the area (African, Vietnamese, Pizza, Chinese, Japanese as well as upscale nouvelle cuisine, e.g., Magnolia Caffe). Shopping areas and a big Target and gym (World Gym) are minutes away.
The uptown entertainment district since Al Capone

name: 04. Pullout sofa bed in common room
description:
This is for the pullout sofa bed in my living room. This is a SHARED common room space and is available to all guests after 8 AM. Please be aware that there is a closet, but that storage is extremely limited. This space is best for those with few bags.

Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning.

The space
This listing is for a pull out bed in my living room on the main floor. The space is a common area where guests can congregate between 8 AM and 10 PM. There is one small closet in this space. All personal belongings must be stowed during the day.

Require privacy? Let me know, I have other options for those willing to spend a little more.

The two levels of our home are set up as individual apartments. The bedrooms and living rooms have spaces rented ou
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the far north neighborhood of Chicago almost as far as you can be from downtown while still being in Chicago. We are the largest concentration of sub-saharan african in the city and as such have an assortment of amazing ethnic food from Jerk Chicken to Senegalese national dish to Ethiopean.

The Red line is exactly 1.1 mile walking from our front door run 24 hours a day. You will encounter homeless people on and around the red line.

Based off the recorded crime statistics from prior years, of 77 neighborhoods in Chicago, we are ranked in the lowest 10 neighborhoods for crime.
host_about:
2021 IMPORTANT: It is up to you, the guest, to verify Chicago rules for incoming travelers.  You cannot book a shared property if you are from a red state unless you have proof of a vaccine.    you can't book if you are from a yellow state unless you have a covid vaccine or negative test in last 72 hours.  

We are no longer refunding in full for guests who book with us and we turn away for not having a vaccine or covid test.  We are unable to continue paying for other people's mistakes :( 

When this happens, our ad was taken down and not able to be booked by other people.  it's the same as the ad not even existing.  The guest shows up, gets denied entry due to this, and then wants a refund for their mistake and we have no opportunity to rebook.

______________________________


Hello!  This is Joe, Alex, and sometimes Bilal.  If you stay here we will be your hosts while here in Chicago. 

We are highly rated hosts not because we have a 5 star luxury property, but because we just about always deliver on what we offer.  The best value in Chicago at this price point doing mostly shared, dorm-style accommodations.  


Please read through our entire ad and offering before asking questions or requesting a stay.  If after that you still have questions feel free to ask.  If you dont and just want to book after reading, I'm positive we will deliver a great stay.  

All of our listings include desks, gigabit internet to share, a full array of breakfast items including bacon, eggs, milk, orange juice, coffee, cereal, tea, oatmeal, at least 2x of fruit, 2x of vegi, cheese, home made bread and jam, and we also take requests for other items that you may enjoy like yogurt, almond milk, or other vegis and fruits we dont already have.  We also often cook for guests and like filling the cookie jar with delicious baked goods throughout the month.  

We have been hosting here for 8 years and absolutely love it.    This is our full time profession but we also dabble in mystery shopping as well as online sales and stained glass.  

We love Airbnb, Chicago, and our guests.   If privacy and being in downtown are not important to you, you'll be hard pressed to find a better Airbnb experience in Chicago at this price point and if you do, we'll probably price match =)

We all look forwarding to meeting those of you who book with us!

description:
Come stay in one of Chicago's rare, historic carriage houses! Located on a quiet street in hip Bucktown, you are steps to restaurants, shopping, bars, and an 8-minute walk to the Blue Line train. This is a very walkable area, day or night!

The space
Hi there.

This historic coach house is conveniently located close to everything Bucktown has to offer, plus close to the Blue Line train and the highway. Parking is included!

Guest access
Feel free to do laundry - I have a laundry room in the unit. I just ask that long-term guests (7 or more days) supply their own detergents and such.

You are welcome to use the patio, too!

Other things to note
Please do not use the fireplace.

License number
City registration pending

host_about:

name: Cozy, Beautiful & Vintage Drenched
description:
Blend into the city by way of our cozy, beautiful, and vintage drenched storefront retreat located in the Ukrainian Village—a thriving neighborhood with the ideal mix of culture, convenience, history and trend.

The space
Our open-design storefront apartment is a meticulously remodeled old tire shop with 14’ white tin ceilings and reclaimed hardwood floors throughout. Our furnishings are focused on that which is eco-friendly, custom, vintage and quality. City of Chicago Registration Number: R17000013532

As you step through the front door, you’ll be greeted by open space; a beautiful baby grand piano and an acoustic guitar. Have a seat on our sofa, put your feet up on the coffee table, and you may never get on that Chicago tour bus. If you travel with computer in tow, we've got movie projection, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, Spotify, a record player (upon request), sound system and quality wireless Internet. If you’re looking to unplug, we’ve got an impre
neighborhood_overview: The historic Ukrainian Village is a beautiful 5-minute walk from Chicago’s harbinger of good times and amazing food, Wicker Park/Bucktown. Explore Damen Avenue's boutiques, coffee shops, craft beer, bookstores, record shops, yoga studios, and more.
host_about: I’m equally at home in the city or country, but the suburbs make me nervous. Born and raised just outside of Bozeman, MT; I make my home with my wife Aura in Chicago. I am a filmmaker and a writer, and I am thankful that I’ve been able to satisfy some wanderlust through my work because two weeks of paid vacation is unsustainable. I prefer diverse setting to solitary attraction, exploration over itinerary, and Airbnb to any resort.

name: Cozy Private Room in a unique Chicago Penthouse
description:
Our three bedroom Penthouse apartment has a cozy guest room with private bathroom. It fits two and is centrally located on a quiet street near Du Paul University. Enjoy a gourmet kitchen, roof access and easy access to major subway lines, coffee shops, restaurants and movie theater are all in walking distance

The space
Please come enjoy a stay in our beautiful, comfortable condo in a quiet residential area. Our unit is located on the 4th floor of a walk-up building housing approximately 9 condo units. You will have access to a private room with private bathroom in a uniquely different & beautiful 3 bedroom and 2 bathroom penthouse unit. This is not your typical 3 bedroom layout. All the vintage charm like exposed brick, wide hallways, oversized windows, hardware floors mixed with todays modern necessities. Living room with great lofted

description:
The space
Our gorgeous apartment located in the heart of Pilsen is available for up to 3 guests. We rehabbed this unit ourselves so everything has been carefully selected and customized. We are looking for the right people to rent to that will take care of our space as if it were their own.

The apartment is an open concept space with 9 foot high ceilings. The bedroom has a queen bed and spacious closet. We also have a queen size air mattress. The bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom. We have a fully stocked kitchen (all stainless steel appliances and granite countertops), Wi-Fi, large-screen 42 inch TV, sectional couch, washer/dryer in the unit and small deck with a grill. Our dining room and bathroom furniture along with several light fixtures throughout the space are custom made by my husband. They are a must see!

We are located 5 blocks west of Halsted on Carpenter Street. We are steps away from a wide selection restaurants and bars (Simone's, Honk
host_about: We spend our time between Chicago, IL and Miami, FL. My husband is an architect/interior designer and with his expertise we have redesigned and rehabbed our home. We love to travel and some of the our favorite destinations include India, Mexico, Senegal, Egypt and Switzerland.

name: MCM Prime LincolnPark 2 Bed 1 Block to Fullerton L
description:
Beautiful historic unit with high ceilings, exposed brick wall, fireplace (nonworking), hardwood floors. Modern granite equipped kitchen, wifi, cable and shared laundry room in 4 unit building. Mid Century Modern furniture accents this amazing rental. Bonus alcove with a twin bed for occasional guest/extra storage. Avoid the cold with your quick commute to the Fullerton L stop (Red Express and Brown, Purple local) with Whole Foods next to it.

The space
Located 1 block from the Fulllerton L stop (Brown Purple & Red Line service), transportation couldn’t be easier. Travel to Magnificent Mile in under 10 minutes, the Loop (Grant Park, Millennium Park, Museum Row) in 12.

For over 20 years, this family-run brownstone, has been offering quality rentals. See why guests return time and again! Located on a quiet side street, the building features a secluded back yard and garage deck. Terrific neighborhood location with abundant restaurants, bars, shops and
neighborhood_overview: Safe and friendly.
host_about:
Travel is fun and exciting but can be hard on the wallet.  It doesn't have to be that way.  Email if you have questions, especially if your requested dates are in the near term and I will do my best to work with you!

Having spent more time than I care to remember in sterile, uninviting hotel rooms, I was initially attracted to vacation rentals as refreshing, and often more affordable, alternatives.  What I found were the same white walls and beige furniture or, even worse, cluttered rooms and Aunt Edna's donated dilapidated couch in the living room.  Well, welcome to something different.  Take a break from your busy schedule by relaxing in clean, inviting rental that that feels enough like home that you're immediately comfortable while being so special you'll look forward to your return.  Many of my guests have been back 2 or 3 times, and some have found themselves venturing across the country to check out another Red Hot Vacation Rental.  

My places are located in Chicago, Miami Beach and San Francisco. I've lived in all 3 cities and am happy to suggest hidden local gems or recommend the best nearby dry cleaner.

The space
Welcome to The Chez EZ a Classic 1920's Four Square with large “hangout" front porch and entertaining backyard on the desirable Bernard St. in HOT Logan Square.

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square has everything you need and want! A vibrant community  with great food, stores, transportation and people!

name: Charming apartment in Old Town
description:
A private studio-apartment (also known as an in-law apartment) is the first floor of an historic home. The apartment has its own private ground floor entrance, living room, kitchen, full bath, and dining and sleeping area. The sleeping area and bed are partitioned from the dining area. It is located in a beautiful historic neighborhood and a 5 minute walk to the lake. The transit station is a block away: a 10 minute ride to downtown (or a 1/2 hour walk along beach from house to downtown).

The space
This is a private ground floor studio apartment with its own private entrance in a restored victorian home in a lovely and leafy historic district in Chicago. It is often said to be the best location in the city. From the house it's a five minute walk to Lake Michigan and an additional 20 minute walk along the lake front to downtown Chicago. Or you can catch the train at the Sedgwick station, 1 block south, with connections to all points of the city and to both
neighborhood_overview: Its a designated Historic Landmark neighborhood, with great restaurants and night life near by.
host_about: I had been working in the visual arts for many years as a designer and art director for a natural history museum where I was constantly learning about how the natural world has evolved.  I decided that I also wanted to know more about how the physical world worked  and returned to school to become a civil engineer where my designer's tools now include gravity, energy and other forces of nature.

Maison de Samantha is a Chicago 3 bd 2.5 bath House built in 1873, located between United Center and Garfield Park Conservatory. Abundant free street parking - guest bedroom has huge closet, queen memory foam bed - bathroom has jet tub and ample storage - spacious main floor has fireplace in living room and the fun kitchen has arcade games and pool table - the back yard garden complete with grill, fire-pit and 2 person hammock. Unique customized home of a designer and her 3 well mannered dogs.

The space
This home has been renovated and is designed with fun eclectic items that are inviting to all our guests. So much room in this home to relax or be a part of the daily activities.
The Guest bedroom has a super comfy queen bed stacked full of pillows, ceiling fan with remote, blackout window treatment options and a ton of storage space in the closet with small desk area. Bathroom has all the needed toiletries and plenty of towels. The owner and her 3 dogs and
neighborhood_overview: The area is two blocks from the green line California train stop and near west loop, west town, bucktown, wicker park and humbolt park. name: Modern Loft-Style Pad in Wicker!
description:
The space
I have a beautiful spare bedroom in my condo that has its own full bathroom available in Wicker Park. Steps away from all Wicker Park has to offer including:

- 5 min walk to the Division blue line stop (which will take you into downtown in under 15 mins and a 30 min ride to the airport!) and a few steps away from the #9 Ashland bus and the #56 Milwaukee Bus.
- great restaurants, shopping, bars, gyms, and stores on Milwaukee and North Ave
- Jewel grocery store is just across the street!
- The always fun 6 points in Wicker Park (Milwaukee, Damen, and North Ave) are about a 10 min walk away and feature several great bars, restaurants, and music venues.

I have lived in Wicker Park for over three years and know the neighborhood very well. Wicker Park is very friendly, safe, and was rated 4th for “Hippest Hipster Neighborhoods” in the country by Forbes magazine. I am super friendly, laid-back, and helpful and would be more than happy
host_about: Laid back, quiet at first, warm, friendly. Work in financial services in downtown Chicago. I have attempting to travel the world, so far only been to Hawaii, Iraq, and Mexico; will try to get to Europe, Asia, and Africa hopefully sooner, rather than later.

neighborhood_overview: The New York Times called Rogers Park the most diverse community in the USA.  You'll find everything you need with easy access to downtown tourist sites, and we're just 3 blocks from the beach!  Great coffee, food, and fun is all within arms reach.
host_about:
COVID-19 UPDATE:  April 1, 2021

As we prepare for reopening hosting this coming May, we ask our previous and new guests to email us with any questions, as we will be following Airbnb and CDC protocols to make sure we all feel comfortable, safe and guests can fully enjoy their stay.  Please note that some amenities may not be offered at this time due to COVID-19.
 
We are anxious to share our spaces and city with you again, and we hope to be able to welcome you soon!

Lois and Eduardo
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Hi there!  We're Lois and Eduardo! She's from Kansas, I'm from Argentina, we met in Spain, and now we live in Chicago!  (¡Hablamos español, por supuesto!)  We've been Chicagoans for over 35 years, love the city, and love our home. Our kids Evan and Gina, our kids-in-law Lindsey and Mark, and our gorgeous grandkids, Enzo and Uma, are around often, and our Labradoodle, Leo, is a sweetie. (He is hypo-allergenic, doesn't shed, and loves people.)

You will note that our kitchen is the focal point of our daily lives, both for conversation and for enjoying Eduardo's delicious, Italian-inspired home cooking.  You might say that our philosophy of life is to work hard, play hard, and enjoy the people around us all the time. One of our favorite things has always been to host our diverse friends and family in our home - sometimes for a day, sometimes for a year.  Now, with AirBnB, we're making it official!  We're happy to say our home feels like an urban oasis and we look forward to hosting you!

name: Beautiful Condo in Chicago
description:
Beautiful 1 bedroom condo in the best location of Chicago. Newly painted and decorated for a beautiful modern look! Condo is two blocks away from The Magnificent Mile (Michigan Ave). Full amenity building (gym, pool, movie theater, grills, 24 hour doorman etc). Parking available in building at an extra cost (about $250/month).
Full kitchen.
*** The pool is being repaired and not available for now***
***The gym is open with limited capacity following the CDC guidelines for COVID-19***

The space
If you are looking for a monthly rental in Chicago this is perfect for you. Gorgeous 1 bedroom, condo unit with very nice views of Chicago. The condo is newly furnished and painted and has everything you might need for your stay (cook ware, microwave, dishwasher, towels, bedding, etc). Recently changed the floors too and there's hardwood throughout (not shown in the pictures). Very large closets with lots of space. One block from Michigan Ave and steps to al
neighborhood_overview: One of the best neighborhoods in Chicago. 2 Blocks from Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile). Steps away from the best restaurants, bars and stores. Very clean and safe area. Great for walking around.
host_about: I'm a business professional and I work in the IT industry as a sales manager. I graduated from Loyola University in Chicago with an MBA a few years ago. I was born in Montevideo, Uruguay but I lived in Buenos Aires, Paris, Barcelona, Washington DC, and Chicago.  I love to travel and I've been to multiple countries around the world. I recently bought this condo in Chicago and I'm renting it out.

name: Chicago Women's Residence/ Paris Rm
description:
A Room of Your Own in this Travelers' Residence for Women(4br). See the real Chicago, easy access to public transportation, enjoy meeting other guests. Have a safe, affordable place to hang your hat while staying in Chicago and seeing the sights.

The space
This women's residence in a 113 yr.old 2 story brick house on near west side of Chicago is close to downtown and only 2 short blocks west of the Kedzie stop on the pink line. It is easy to get all over from here! 4 bedrooms!
The place is totally furnished even with linens, dishes,towels, pans, etc. There are 3 bedrooms, a living room, kitchen, bathroom, deck off kitchen on 2nd floor.

There is no smoking inside the building.
We have a very secure building in a residential neighborhood. We have been here for 10 years at this location. I have been renting rooms to women since 1984! Only trustworthy and kind women rent here. Is that you?!

Guest access
This bedroom on 1

On the lower level- there is an art studio and laundry area. We have a large garden for flowers and relaxing with nature outside.
I have 3
neighborhood_overview: Friendly African American neighborhood with plenty of walking space. People say hello here! Say hello back, or even first. This is a very urban environment.  This part of the neighborhood is friendly, people are nice, and things are o.k. even though not each house is picturesque. We have been located here 12 years without incidents. How many people can say that?! Neighbors know we are here, we teach their kids, we all look out for each other. We feel safe.

name: Chicago Women's Residence Midler Rm
description:
Enjoy multi-cultural women's residence w/your own bedroom, share common rooms. full kitchen access w/everything needed to cook. outside deck, parking out front. gardens. doggies to greet you. manager lives on site. lots of art on display! public transportation 2 blocks away!

The space
Women's Residence is located at 1957 S. Spaulding Ave. corner of 21st , just 2 blocks west of the Kedzie stop on pink line. 116 year old red brick house with large flower gardens. 1st floor is art gallery, office, extra bedroom for guests, and manager's rooms. Lower level is art studio and laundry area. 2nd floor is women's residence with 3 bedrooms, living room, bathroom, and kitchen with outside deck off kitchen in back of house. The entire place is totally furnished with furniture, linens, dishes, etc. Just need your clothing & toothbrush for a room of your own! All guests may use common rooms! Everyone is screened to stay at this quiet, unique place. We have a daily rate of $45.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a residential, mostly African American neighborhood. We know each other. There is a feeling of spaciousness and real life here. Plenty of families, children, and old folks in this area. People say hello on the sidewalks when they pass each other!
It is easy to walk around here. Plenty to walk to and do. We are close to the large Douglas Park. It has a cultural center with lots to do including in the summer a large outdoor swimming pool.
It is easy to catch a Cermak bus one block away and go to Chinatown and have fun looking around. It is easy to catch the pink line train 2 blocks away and go downtown where there are million things to do- many are free! The nearby park has a lagoon and fishing and bird watching- all free! United Center for games and events is extremely close.
We have a lot of trees in the neighborhood. We border a Latino neighborhood so walking distance to lots of great Mexican food and art!
host_about: artist dog lover!

Along with a building-wide commitment to environmental sensitive practices, the property offers vintage charm and cutting edge design, ensuring a comfortable sanctuary in the middle of Chicago's bustling artist/boutique community.
Wit
host_about:
Hi!  :)  I'm Jason- a friendly, hyperactive, short and energetic fellow from the MidWest who loves building stuff and going places.  I'm a "people-person" from a family of world travelers; 4th generation Chicago cityboy with experience working in museums, hotels and ecolodges around the globe. 
Chicago history, architecture, and preservation are big interests of mine, and I take great pride in caring for the historic properties my family has lived in, owned & maintained for decades. 

I love AirBnb.  We have traveled, backpacked, hiked, camped, hoteled moteled, couch-surfed and home-shared... But AirBnb has been the single best thing to happen to us in our adult lives.

When we travel, we turn to AirBnb first, whether internationally, nationally, and in our own hometown.  From the glitzy new city experience to weekend trip to some small town in the country, we prefer staying with those in the AirBnb community.  The experience is always unique and always more authentic.

We are AirBnb hosts and consider it central to our lives here in Chicago.  Because my family lives in Chicago, one of us is always in the city, often while the rest of us travel. Any repairs are handled immediately. A while back, when I was moving from the building we own, we decided to open it for AirBnB guests. Now we have progressed to having vacation rentals within the building where we live.  Living nearby with my partner Alyssa allows us to keep in great touch with our guests, maintaining the gardens and accommodations ourselves, as well as hosting occasional art, music and dining events. 

I love this way of traveling and hosting; meeting the folks who come to stay with us is precisely what fuels me on the day-to-day, and it's what makes our vacations so much more enjoyable!  We've met hundreds of incredible people and stayed in fantastic homes across the world.  AirBnb has been such a great chapter in our lives!  :)

I am in between the California and Western stops. Close to many cute neighborhood coffee shops, breweries, restaurants, and shops. 15 minute walk to the spacious (and very green) Humboldt Park. 5 minute walk from the 606. The apartment is well-laid out and gives guests good privacy.

host_about:
I am a warm, energetic, open-minded person who loves to travel!  I love living in the city where I am close to so many greats places and dear friends. name: 02b. Twin bed in Coed Space
description:
This is for a single twin bed in a SHARED bedroom. You will have a twin bed that is in a bedroom with another full bed. The other bed is a separate listing, and is NOT included with this booking.
Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning.

The space
This ad is for a twin bed in a shared room that might have another guest sharing the room on the other bed. Require privacy? Let me know, I sometimes have other options for those willing to spend a little more.

We run dorm-style listings here with 2 beds per bedroom. We have and enforce quiet hours from 10pm until 8am in sleeping areas. We maintain a 24 hour common space that can be used during quiet hours. We have two bathrooms and two kitchens. We have gigabit internet shared among everyone. We have two cats.
<
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the far north neighborhood of Chicago almost as far as you can be from downtown while still being in Chicago. We are the largest concentration of sub-saharan african in the city and as such have an assortment of amazing ethnic food from Jerk Chicken to Senegalese national dish to Ethiopean.

The Red line is exactly 1.1 mile walking from our front door run 24 hours a day. You will encounter homeless people on and around the red line.

Based off the recorded crime statistics from prior years, of 77 neighborhoods in Chicago, we are ranked in the lowest 10 neighborhoods for crime.
host_about:
2021 IMPORTANT: It is up to you, the guest, to verify Chicago rules for incoming travelers.  You cannot book a shared property if you are from a red state unless you have proof of a vaccine.    you can't book if you are from a yellow state unless you have a covid vaccine or negative test in last 72 hours.  

We are no longer refunding in full for guests who book with us and we turn away for not having a vaccine or covid test.  We are unable to continue paying for other people's mistakes :( 

When this happens, our ad was taken down and not able to be booked by other people.  it's the same as the ad not even existing.  The guest shows up, gets denied entry due to this, and then wants a refund for their mistake and we have no opportunity to rebook.

______________________________


Hello!  This is Joe, Alex, and sometimes Bilal.  If you stay here we will be your hosts while here in Chicago. 

We are highly rated hosts not because we have a 5 star luxury property, but because we just about always deliver on what we offer.  The best value in Chicago at this price point doing mostly shared, dorm-style accommodations.  


Please read through our entire ad and offering before asking questions or requesting a stay.  If after that you still have questions feel free to ask.  If you dont and just want to book after reading, I'm positive we will deliver a great stay.  

All of our listings include desks, gigabit internet to share, a full array of breakfast items including bacon, eggs, milk, orange juice, coffee, cereal, tea, oatmeal, at least 2x of fruit, 2x of vegi, cheese, home made bread and jam, and we also take requests for other items that you may enjoy like yogurt, almond milk, or other vegis and fruits we dont already have.  We also often cook for guests and like filling the cookie jar with delicious baked goods throughout the month.  

We have been hosting here for 8 years and absolutely love it.    This is our full time profession but we also dabble in mystery shopping as well as online sales and stained glass.  

We love Airbnb, Chicago, and our guests.   If privacy and being in downtown are not important to you, you'll be hard pressed to find a better Airbnb experience in Chicago at this price point and if you do, we'll probably price match =)

We all look forwarding to meeting those of you who book with us!

name: The Biddle House (#2)
description:
The Biddle House is located in Historic Old Town on a lovely tree-lined street, walking distance to many wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront.

Features one queen bed in each bedroom and twin sleeper sofa, plus a single jacuzzi hot tub and shower.

The space
The Biddle House is located in historic Old Town on a quiet tree-lined street, walking distance to wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront.

Public transportation is a breeze from here - get downtown in 10 minutes on Chicago's famous El train (brown line)! You'll be a short walk from the Sedgwick Brown Line stop.

The second floor apartment has two bedrooms, one bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen, dining room and living room. Continental breakfast fixings are provided. The units here get great natural light as well!

The apartment includes high-speed internet (wi-fi), cable tv, private phone lines, and complimentary washer and dryer in the building.
neighborhood_overview: Old Town is the Historic District of Chicago. The neighborhood is beyond charming, located just north of the Gold Coast, filled with countless restaurants and boutiques, walking distance to the History Museum, Michigan Ave (15 min walk), DePaul University, Armitage Street and the Lincoln Park Zoo! A wonderful location to experience Chicago!
host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing throughout the city in or near Old Town and Lincoln Park.

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City.  Topo Gigio is a great local Italian Restaurant and The Gemini Bistro is an excellent choice for fine dining. And Velvet Taco, casual with its own unique style on Lincoln is fabulous!

The free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

name: Private room in Chicago
description:
A lovely brownstone built in the 1800's. This neighborhood was the site of Chicago's version of yesterday's original splendor with today's modern amenities. This house is minutes from the lake, downtown and the museums.

The space
This space is unique because you will see the beauty of art from the moment you step inside the gate. You will enjoy a nice comfortable space with your own private bathroom. This is your home away from home once you settle in from all the sightseeing Chicago has to offer.

Guest access
This private room is a master bedroom with soaring cathedral ceilings. Private bath is equipped with jacuzzi tub, marble sink, and walk-in separate shower. This space has wifi access Parking is easy and free on the street or connect to a bus that is 10 minutes from downtown.

name: Spacious & serene in hip spot. Sleeps 4.
description:
Located in the center of Pilsen, a vibrant neighborhood rich in Mexican arts/ culture, and an emerging hipsterville. Check out art gallery crawls, award winning restaurants and local taquerias. Thalia Hall (3 blocks away) featuring indie and major musicians. 7 minutes via car to downtown or 2 blocks to train/bus.

All guests (over 2 y/o) must wear masks while entering the house and walking through common areas. Please don’t book with us if you are unwilling/unable to wear a masks. Safety first!

The space
This is a 2500 square foot single family home with 12 foot ceilings and the higher end trappings of inhabitants who are coffee, food, and lifestyle snobs (but no snobbish personalities!).

Your Space:
-Large private bedroom with a super comfy queen size bed and plenty of closet space
-Shared access to a full bathroom on your floor with shower and large jacuzzi tub (strong water pressure and large hot water heater)
-Coffe
neighborhood_overview: Pilsen is our favorite neighborhood in Chicago and is in the midst of dramatic change - hopefully change that retains the vibrant Mexican culture that makes it what it is. This is an artistic and culinary mecca for Chicago, with galleries throughout the neighborhood, politically and socially conscious murals on every block, and a wide array of food, including some of Chicago's best Mexican cuisine. The Mexican Fine Arts Museum is one of the best in the country. Several breweries are located here, along with dive bars, comedy spots, upscale fusion restaurants and music and mole festivals throughout the warm months. This is a demographically diverse community that is still dominated by Mexican families, but has a strong hipster and young professional presence as well. Get ready for Portlandia style beards and coiffed dogs.
host_about: I'm co-founder of a mission-driven company that helps bring more nature into cities and use it to reduce pollution from stormwater runoff.  Am constantly using AirBnB for all of my work-related travel as I meet with partners and community members in cities across the country. I am also an Airbnb host myself, so I have a deep understanding of both what it takes to host and what it takes to be a great guest.

name: Magic Factory, Chef kitchen, art, dine, relax 3bdr
description:
This is THE place to stay to visit local family & friends. Our funky warehouse & former tavern turned costume factory turned fabulous Lincoln Park home can be your home away from home in Chicago. Everything you need is here: a chef's kitchen, extra large dining table, cable TV, superfast Wifi, spacious open plan lets you spread out & still visit.
Come visit your friends & family & feel at home.
Located at the crossroads of Lincoln Park - Old Town & River North -

The space
Our fabulous 3 bedroom home in a converted warehouse on Halsted street between North Avenue and Division Street. It’s roughly halfway between the highway and Lake Shore Drive, 2 blocks from the Red Line to downtown or the north side, 3 stops to Wrigley field and equal distance from the North and Division buses that run to Wicker Park and Bucktown.


Why choose us?
*Three Queen (double) beds
- 1 QUAD BEDROOM
- 1 TRIPLE BEDROOM
- 1 QUEEN BED
neighborhood_overview:
We are the center of the Chicago universe at the crossroads of:
Lincoln Park
Old Town
River North
River West
Wicker Park
The West Loop
Boystown
There is no where you cannot get to easily from our Lincoln Park loft home.
host_about:
Who would have thought when I boarded a plane for Greece more than 20 years ago, planning on backpacking through the mountains and then heading north through then Yugoslavia I'd end up making Greece my second home?
But here I am, 20 something years later, running a fabulous Greek vacation rental business with historic homes & penthouses in Athens, planning Greek travel itineraries and leading small group food & wine focused tours around my adopted homeland and loving the life that I am lucky enough to be living. Of course I did pick up an equally crazy, workaholic Greek husband along the way, as well as a stray Greek animal or two!

Update: End of November 2017 .... This year Basil and I celebrate 15 years opening our Greek vacation rentals to guests from around the world. All these years we've been hopping between Basil's home city, Athens and Carole's home city of Chicago.  Time and time again guests in Greece ask us if they can stay in our Chicago home while we're in Athens.... so we're finally doing it - we've just completed the renovation of a fab old factory with 3 vacation rentals called the Magic Factory Lofts. We've got 3 and 4 bedroom homes in the heart of the city with Big Shoulders -  in our hybrid warehouse (which in a previous life housed a bar and a dance hall, followed by a costume and magic card factory and then a photography studio where probably every Butterball turkey advertisement in the 1980s was shot .... the photos, not the turkeys!)

So come stay with us ... and then stay with us again. Whether we share an ouzo in Athens in our Acropolis View Alpha Plus penthouse or Sky Villa or a beer and a hot dog in Chicago, in our Magic Factory Lofts  we know that you won't be disappointed.

description:
Enjoy Chicago's Gold Coast in the famous Florsheim Mansion. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Mansion is a perfect destination for families or groups with 5 bedrooms and 5 bathrooms; sleeps up to 12. If you are booking more than three months in advance, please contact us at the Florsheimmansion web/site for a special discount code of 30% savings on any booking.

The space
Enjoy Chicago as “patrons of the arts” in the famous Florsheim Mansion for the Arts B&B in Chicago's Gold Coast at 1328 N. State Parkway. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Florsheim Mansion for the Arts is a perfect destination for families or groups.

The legendary residence was built by famous architect, Andrew Rebori in 1938 and was home to shoe heiress and sculptor, Lillian Florsheim, who purchased the place in 1946. The famed house has been called one of the "sexiest homes in Chicago" by Chicago Magazine. It is a si
neighborhood_overview: The Gold Coast is unsurpassed in Chicago as THE neighborhood for shopping, dining, and walking.  You are steps from the Magnificent Mile, Rush Street, and most of the city's major attractions.

neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is on one site residential and the other site (website hidden) has lots of little places to eat ,an unique coffee/bicycle place were people take there (website hidden) is close to Lincoln Park conservatory and the Zoo .You can walk to Wrigley Field ,the John Hancock, and  theaters are down the street.
host_about:
I am from the Netherlands,lived in Germany and Switzerland before I came here.I have three daughters and five grandchildren,my husband was from Greece. I still have family in Athens and we had one of the girls baptized there and an other one got married there.When my middle daughter studied in Florence ,Italy we  went many times to see her.I enjoy art and good food.I like to read love a good book,enjoy the movies and have a subscription to the Lyric Opera and try to go to as many concerts as I can .
We are not far from Wrigley Field and if i can't go to a baseball game there I will see it on the t.v. I like sports,golf ,tennis ,soccer.The little kids here play soccer and I go to their games.
I love Chicago and I have lived here now for over 50 years which was not my intention but this place is very international and very welcoming and I stayed.

name: Park Views-Walk to Orange Line(MDW)
description:
Two bed room apartment in a vintage 130 year old red brick two flat overlooking 70 acres of Mckinley Park in a sleepy working class neighborhood. Ten minute 1/2 mile walk to the 35th/Archer CTA Orange line station with rapid transit service to Chicago's Loop, Midway Airport and the many cultural attractions the city has to offer.

The space
Decorated with an artists eye and a working-class budget with a focus on calm and comfortable. Sunny top floor with western facing bay windows overlooking McKinley Park.

Guest access
The entire top floor apartment is yours. Large eat in kitchen with all the amenities for cooking. Comfortable living room with large flat panel TV. Two bedrooms with two full beds.

The back porch stairway is for emergency use only.

Other things to note
The building is 132 years strong. With all the vintage charm comes a few squeaky floor boards. You may hear the downstairs on occasion or
neighborhood_overview:
McKinley Park has been a working-class area throughout its long history. Two blocks to the south along Pershing is the historic Central Manufacturing District. It has been described as the United States' first planned industrial district and features some surprisingly decorative warehouses from the turn of the century as well as an old clock tower. The juxtaposition of a city park on one side of Pershing with old huge 10 story warehouses on the other is incredibly unique and worth scoping out.

More information
Keep in mind the McKinley Park neighborhood is more of a quiet refuge from night life. You'll have to venture a little further for restaurants or bars. Pilsen to the north and Bridgeport to the east are excellent options for restaurants both easily accessible by a short CTA bus ride or Divvy Bike. Chicago's China town is a quick trip down the Orange line.

The nearest grocery market is Cermak Produce three blocks to the north.

name: Cozy 2BR Apt - Humboldt Park
description:
This comfortable two bedroom garden flat is the perfect place to stay during your visit. Guests will be staying in one of Chicago's quickly changing neighborhoods with convenient access to public transportation and free wifi and cable tv.

The space
Enjoy a remodeled two bedroom and one bath garden flat in Humboldt Park. The building is located on a tree-lined street conveniently located near three CTA bus lines. You will enjoy a new kitchen minus a stove but there is a Kitchenmaid toaster oven and an electric cooktop, skillet, griddle and kettle for you to use. Guests will sleep on very comfortable Sealy Posturepedic mattresses. There is a storage area to keep your luggage as well as a laundry room that you may use. The laundry room is shared with the other residents in the building.

Main bedroom has a Queen size bed and full size closet and mirror.
Second bedroom has a full-size (double) bed, mirror and portable storage and cloths rack.
neighborhood_overview:
The Humboldt Park neighborhood is quickly changing with many new shops and restaurants opening up. Close by is a very good coffee shop called CC Ferns, a soda shop, Spinning J, a wine bar and two taverns/bars. There are several vintage stores as well within walking distance.

Humboldt Park is to the north and is about a 5 minute walk. It's the biggest park in Chicago and provides many opportunities to enjoy the outdoors from picnicking to watching the sunset on downtown Chicago.

Other food with bars and restaurants and still within walking distance are on Western Ave.

Division St which is very popular and has a busy nightlife is a quick 5 minute cab away but you can also take the 70 Division bus that goes right there.

Logan Square has numerous new and popular restaurants in the area and is maybe a 5-10 minute cab away but this can also be reached by the 52 California bus. The stop is a block away from your apartment.

Chicago A

name: Victorian greystone near Loyola U!
description:
Private, spacious 2 BR apartment in interesting, diverse neighborhood with great restaurants and beaches! Walk to several different bus lines and train lines to go downtown and other nearby Northside neighborhoods.

The space
This listing is for an entire private 2-bedroom apartment in the Rogers Park neighborhood of Chicago. The apartment is over 1200 square feet (111 sq meters) and has tall 9.5' ceilings (2.9 meters), a marble bath, and hardwood floors throughout. There is also a charmingly retro yet fully functional kitchen in the apartment. The apartment comprises the entire first floor of the 2 unit building.
There is a 50” Smart TV to watch Netflix and other streaming services, and a DVD player with a USB port.
There is a full sized bed in the smaller bedroom, a queen sized bed and a twin bed in the larger bedroom, and the sofa folds out into a full sized bed.

Guest access
The apartment is private, and we live in the apartmen
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is on the far north side of Chicago and borders Lake Michigan to the east, Evanston to the north, and the Edgewater neighborhood to the south. We love Rogers Park's diversity and its neighborhood feel. Shops and amenities are all easy to walk to. The apartment is also within walking distance to the lake and to Loyola university. There are numerous restaurants and bars within walking distance as well. In addition, the apartment is also easily accessible to Evanston and northside Chicago neighborhoods such as Andersonville (10 minute bus ride) and Lakeview (15 min train ride+15 min walk to the train). You can get downtown via public transportation in about 45 minutes or 15 minutes via car or taxi.
host_about:
Lisa, Caitlin, and our son Lars live in Chicago, IL, USA. We loved traveling in Airbnbs so much we decided to welcome visitors in our spare room. When we were ready to stop sharing a bathroom with guests, we found an opportunity to offer our guests a full apartment. We love meeting people from all around the world and giving them a place to live in our corner of Chicago. Lars was born in 2016 and has given us the chance to provide family-friendly amenities to guests traveling with babies. 
 I speak a little German, and Lisa speaks a little Turkish, but neither of us speak well enough to try and answer your questions about Chicago!

host_about: Michigan native who moved to Chicago right after graduating from the University of Michigan for work. I enjoy traveling as much as possible and my hobbies include rock climbing, yoga and scuba diving. I am always open to meeting new people and love hearing other people's life stories

name: *Recent Price Drop! Superb location!
description:
Our place is your home away from home! Our neighborhood is great, conveniently located and we pride ourselves in being the best hosts possible by providing you with all the information you need to make your stay in Chicago great. See full description

The space
Quaint neighborhood right outside of busy downtown close to the United center, with lounges and bars within walking distance. Directly down the street from Navy Pier on Grand Ave. A few blocks from Harpo studios Bottom Lounge music venue. Free wifi, and a rare find in Chicago - free street parking!(when available, which is usually often.)

More about the space and the area:
A converted storefront, Blush Lounge is located in the west loop area, in one of the most entertaining neighborhoods in Chicago, close to all the sights, where there is always something to do.
This private bedroom has a big, comfy queen size bed and a 32" LCD monitor and a DVD player, sorry no cable. I have a few DVDs
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is beautiful, everything is close by!
host_about: Hi everyone!  Tracy and Josue here. :) We've been living in Chicago for quite some time now. Beautiful city to travel to! A little bit about us. I (Tracy) used to be a photographer but decided to change careers and become a Mortician.  Josue is a Socialite, Traveller, Humanitarian, Activist, Producer and Investor. We love everything we do and hosting for Airbnb is definitely one of them.  When our guests are happy we are happy. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable and amazing as possible. Josue is great with directions, places to check out, things to do, events and nightlife. He knows how to make an awesome drink as well! I love to cook and try new recipes. We both like to go out and experience nightlife, love being foodies and trying out new restaurants when the time permits. Love to travel as well, but Chicago is our Home for now! We are happy to share the experience!

name: Spacious Stylish One Bedroom Apt In HydePark
description:
My one bedroom apartment is comfortable and spacious, located in the popular Hyde Park neighborhood of Chicago. 1 block away from President Barrack Obama's home and the beautiful Univ. of Chicago campus, this is one of the most coveted neighborhoods in the city. Walking distance to all public transportation.

The space
My apartment is truly a gem of the city and Hyde Park neighborhood. It is located in a quiet and quaint building with friendly and helpful neighbors. I live next door to amazing restaurants (Cedars Mediterranean,Leona's Italian, Chicago's Famous Harold's Chicken) a great produce market, fully stocked liquor store, CVS drug store, coffee shops, and health food store. I am also within a block of a movie theater, LA fitness gym, Core Power Yoga, Giordano's Pizza (the famous stuffed Chicago kind). This is truly one of the greatest and most culturally diverse neighborhoods in Chicago, and rich in amazing history. My apartment is within walking dista
neighborhood_overview: I absolutely adore my neighborhood, and while Chicago is a city defined by great neighborhoods, Hyde Park is one of the best hands down. Located near the University of Chicago, it is one of the most culturally diverse neighborhoods in the city.  I love that I can walk everywhere from the grocery store, my favorite coffee shop, the library, the movie theater, the lake, you name it and I can get there by foot in a matter of minutes.  I work a lot in the city so I also love that I can either drive my car or take public transportation to downtown and be there within a few minutes.  The metra train, L trains, and CTA buses are all within walking distance.  Guests should definitely explore the amazing University of Chicago campus, take a bike ride on the lake, stroll by President Barrack Obama's home (which he still stays in when he comes to Chicago), tour the amazing Osaka Gardens from the Chicago Worlds Fair, and eat at any of the great restaurants in my neighborhood.  There are some cool
host_about: Originally from Los Angeles but currently residing in Chicago.  I love the city and all of the amazing things it has to offer. Museums, theater, awesome restaurants, and bike rides by the lake.

name: Lakeview / Lincoln Park Vintage
description:
A fully-furnished and updated Vintage apartment located on the 1st floor of a 2 flat w/ rear yard, BBQ & outdoor dining table .

Nestled in the heart of Chicago's iconic Lincoln Park, this is a perfect jumping off point to anywhere in the city. We are two and half blocks from the CTA brown line, a mile from 90/94, and a mile from Wrigley Field. The neighborhood is full of great restaurants and bars all within walking distance.

Don't leave your furry friends at home, we are pet friendly!

The space
This is a fully-furnished, 2 bed, 1 bath apartment located in the middle of the Lakeview-Lincoln Park neighborhoods. Car is optional; everything is within walking distance. Parking passes for the area are included with your rental. Wifi and U-verse TV provided. Special rates for the winter months and longer stays. This apartment is a fully-licensed Chicago Vacation Rental, #2209110.

Guest access
When you arrive at the apartm
neighborhood_overview: Lakeview/Lincoln Park is a truly car-optional city neighborhood. We originally feel in love with the architecture and the friendly neighbors. Everything (grocery store, multiple bars/restaurants, public transportation, etc.) is within a walkable distance and we located less than 2 miles from Lake Michigan!
host_about:
My wife, Diane and I are long-time Chicago residents.  We love the city and what it has to offer. 

We built the Coral Reef Beach House in Florida 10 years ago and have enjoyed sharing it with guests over the years. 

We have owned and lived in our two flat in the Lakeview/Lincoln Park neighborhood for 28 years. We have rented the 1st floor apartment as a vacation rental for the last 8 years, and we have enjoyed hosting guests from all over the world!

It is interesting to have an urban vacation rental and also a vacation rental located off the beaten track out on a bridge-less island in Florida, North Captiva Island. 

We rent vacation rentals when we travel and always enjoy the personal touches and uniqueness of each accommodation. We look forward to sharing our properties with our guests. 

So if you have interest in staying at either of our properties please feel free to contact us with any questions. 

We look forward to your stay! 

Mark

name: Casa Corazón (W) near Rush / UIC
description:
Minutes from Rush University Medical Center and UIC, this home is tucked away in the hidden gem of the "Heart of Chicago" neighborhood. The Loop is located just 5 miles away while McCormick Place is accessible by a 20-minute direct bus ride.

The space
Your room is bright and airy with a comfy bed dressed in fresh sheets, fluffy pillows and snuggly blankets. Should your exploration of Chicago have you here longer than a few days, there is a closet in your room waiting to accommodate your wardrobe. And if you are the culinary kind, our kitchen has all the tools you'll need for you to feel right at home. Your bathroom is shared.

Details:
– Twin bed
– Fresh linens and towels
– Shared bath
– Free WiFi
– Use of washer / dryer
– Full use of gourmet kitchen

Other things to note
Meow:
There is a cat on the premises who keeps to himself. While his people are gifted in the art of hospitality, he airs on th
neighborhood_overview: "Heart of Chicago" has a rich ethnic heritage.  Established at the end of the 19th century, it was first inhabited by the Bohemian working class. Since then it has experienced the richness of an Italian population and more recently Hispanic. Our house is right around the corner from a handful of some of the remaining old school Italian restaurants and taquerias can be found on most corners.
host_about: I am a sculptor with a love for language and new cultural experiences. I am kind and warm with a preference for books over devices and people over profiles.

name: South Loop Cozy 2BdRm parking&WiFi&NetFlix
description:
Great for WFH, staycations, vacations & families.

Huge, bright, clean, quiet, affordable 2 bedroom apartment with kitchen, living & bathroom. Very close to downtown/loop, close to parks & stadium. Easy access to buses and trains. Close to bars and restaurants. $0 sec deposit, fast WiFi, free parking, and Netflix!

Close to downtown, buses and trains.

The space
Great for WFH (very fast Internet), staycations, vacations & families.

Centrally located large 2 bedroom apartment with real beds and refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, etc. Living room has a couch and TV with Netflix. We provide an additional bedroom making it a 3 bedroom and additional air-mattresses if your team is large, we have hosted 12 people before. The space comfortable fits 10. See the reviews.

The apartment is very close to downtown and great view of city from the top rear deck of the building. Affordable, clean, friendly, close proximity
neighborhood_overview:
The food, drinks, and the people are great. The neighborhood is 10-15 minutes walk from most of the popular places. The apartment is close to numerous public transportation and public bike rental.

The apartment has its own private entrance
host_about:
We are clean and neat freaks that have hosted over 2000 different sets of Airbnb guests from all over the world in our Chicago apartments!. Our apartments are in the south and west loop of downtown Chicago. The museums, stadiums (United Center, Soldier Field, etc.), and McCormick Place, Thalia hall, China town, University of Illinois, University of Chicago,  Rush university, Medical district are all close and easily accessible. The magnificent mile is: 9 minutes by bus and 5 minutes by taxi or Uber. 
 
We are friendly people who enjoy meeting new friends and traveling. We have lived in the Caribbean, London, and New York before moving to Chicago. Came to Chicago primarily for school but then we loved it and decided to stay. Yes, we love Chicago, and even the winter is GREAT! Good food options are unbelievably amazing in Chicago.

I have multiple apartments on this website. Some of the apartments are  3 bedrooms, bathroom, living room, dining room, and kitchen. Some are two bedrooms, bathroom, living, and kitchen and the others are 1 bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room. We provide additional airbeds if needed. The airbeds are extremely comfortable and are queen size and 18 inches high. 

All the apartments have free WiFi, guestbooks, and basic amenities such as TV, iron, iron board, refrigerator, hair dryer, with water, pop, and juice, microwave, coffee maker, cups, plates, pots, pans, bathroom towels, shower items, etc.

Airbnb is extremely fun for us since we are also international.  We have traveled to most of the states in the US, London, Milan,  Italy, Turkey. I have also attended Universities on both sides of the Atlantic (London and Chicago). 

Favorite music are Reggae, R&B, hip hop, Latin music, country music. I love to eat and my favorite food are fish, fruits, and vegetables. My favorite sports are rock climbing, archery, diving, soccer, and basketball. 

These days if I am not out with friends, I am with family, or spending time on the computer. My life motto is working hard and taking care of health!!!!!

description:
LARGE Bedroom (22'x12' / 24.5m²) w/ private-access FULL ensuite stocked bathroom, TV, microwave, mini-fridge, complimentary tea, dresser, desk, closet, iron/ironing board, & wifi. Access to full kitchen & washer/dryer. Parking spot available. 3 blocks to University of Chicago, 4 blocks to Green Line CTA, 5 blocks to Metra Electric Line.

The space
This quiet, sunny, spacious, private room is tucked into the back of our two-story house for maximum privacy away from the street. Manage your comfort with the central heat/ac or get some fresh air by opening the windows or maybe turn on the ceiling fan. Pull down the shades and draw the blackout velvet curtains to sleep in for as long as you like.

You can relax in the tub of your own full private bathroom and use the complimentary toiletries. Get some work done at the desk or watch TV while lounging in the full-size bed and sip some complimentary tea.

neighborhood_overview:
Wake up and stop by the Robust Coffee shop for a cup of jo and Belgian waffle on your fifteen-minute walk to the University of Chicago Medical School or the University’s main quad. Or stop by Daley’s Restaurant, the oldest diner in Chicago, only a few blocks away on 63rd and Cottage Grove Ave.

Jump on Lake Shore Drive in your car and enjoy the beautiful lakeside on your easy ten-minute drive to Chicago’s City Center.

Hop on the Green Line to access the downtown Museum Campus (Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, Soldier Field, etc.).

Enjoy several popular attractions within walking distance:
• Logan Center Exhibitions
• Joseph Regenstein Library & Mansueto Dome
• Museum of Science and Industry
• DuSable Museum of African American History
• Oriental Institute Museum (history, art, and archaeology of ancient Near East)
• Smart Museum of Art
• Frank Lloyd Wright’s Frederick C. Robie House
• R

description:

The space
Things to consider prior to booking: I am a firm believer in the sharing economy. With that said understand this unit is not ran like a hotel which keep our rates low. However we have higher end amentities like plenty of fluffy towels and high thread count sheets. The garden apartment with many imperfections is our personal space that we gladly share with you at a rate lower then most other rentals in the area. Comfy and cozy with creaking floors and some exposed pipes this old style is the ambiance of the unit. Its a place to rest after exploring our beautiful neighborhood and city of Chicago. The residence has other apartments and other tenants that live there. There are pets on the premises (not in your apartment) that are v

The apartment is close to Logan Square, Wicker Park, and Lincoln Park however they are not in walking distance. Approximately 7 miles from downtown and 3 miles from Wrigley Field. There is a Divvy Bike Station just down the street. Divvy is the Chicago Bike share Program in which you may rent a bike for a few hours or the entire day. We are off of Elston Street which is also a shared bike path to down town Chicago.
host_about: I am a resourceful and detailed host who was born and raised in the city of Chicago. My passions include Chicago House music, street art, graphic design and tacos. Any destination with warm weather, clear water, and a beach is a place I want to be now.

description:

Located on one of Chicago's most beautiful tree-lined streets, you are close to everything... cafes, restaurants, transportation, clubs. Experience Chicago like a native with my guidance. This is a private spacious bedroom suite in my 2-story, 2000sf apartment. The room, bathroom, and deck are yours alone to enjoy! There are no other guests in my home.

The space
This is a private (and quiet), light-filled bedroom and bath suite with contemporary furnishings in a very clean and beautifully designed, 2-level apartment. I personally clean the space, and all bedding, towels, and surfaces are sanitized and freshly washed before each guest arrives. The bed is super comfortable with high-count cotton sheets and cozy pillows. There is plenty of storage space for both hanging and folded clothes, a definite plus for extended stays. A large des
neighborhood_overview:
I'm on the border of Lincoln Park and Lakeview on one of Chicago's most lovely streets. I am within walking distance of DePaul University for visiting parents! This is a residential neighborhood with beautiful private homes and small apartment buildings like mine. I'm close to everything, but the neighborhood is safe and quiet. I love walking around and discovering new restaurants and shops, and sharing these with my guests.
Walk to Chicago blues clubs, restaurants, micro-brew restaurants, coffee shops and transportation.
host_about: I've lived in Chicago all of my adult life so I know the city very well. I can enhance your visit to the Windy City with lots of great advice and ideas of where to hear great music, enjoy wonderful inexpensive food, find great shopping and make the most of your time here. I've traveled to Europe, China, India, Nepal, Mexico, Canada and throughout the U.S. and love meeting fellow travelers! I also love Chicago and want everyone who visits to get to know the city in a personal way. I'm an artist/designer, as well as a yoga teacher. I welcome all considerate, thoughtful guests who want to share my home.

neighborhood_overview:
Lakeview's Wrigleyville is one of Chicago's liveliest and most vibrant neighborhoods. Several distinct areas all meld together to form a family friendly community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor.

Southport Corridor Shopping---Hit the bustling commercial shopping districts on Southport Ave, Belmont & Halstead Streets for those one of a kind finds!

Wrigleyville Restaurants---Live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless bars and pubs, and celebrated restaurants; the dining choices are endless!

Lakeview / Wrigleyville Arts and Culture----live music venues, several summer street festivals and a thriving scene for theater, dance and comedy.

The space

Conveniently located just minutes from the Loop (downtown) McCormick Place Expo Center and Wintrust Arena. Easy access to all major subway lines & Buses. Chicago is known for Art in public places is one of the hallmarks of our great city. I screen guest(s) carefully and require guest to go through Airbnb verification + a completely filled-Airbnb-profile with a current photo.

Airbnb only releases your phone number after a paid reservation and does not allow the sharing of websites, and emails prio
neighborhood_overview:
The Bronzeville/Hyde Park area is rich in amazing history, greatest and most CULTURALLY DIVERSE neighborhoods in Chicago. NBA All-Star Games 2020 in Chicago -United Center. The half-time feature performances by locals Chance "The "Rapper" and Common.

This area is very walkable — most errands can be accomplished on foot. Transit is good, with many nearby public transportation options. It’s convenient to use a bike for most trips. The TRANSIT score for the area is sixty four, the BIKE score is seventy four and WALK score is seventy nine.

Best Way for late night travel after 9pm (if you can afford it & spend the extra cash) is a Taxi/Cab/Uber. The buzzing night life is in the loop/down-town or in the area of your gathering/conference/Experience.
host_about: The Elect Lady Grayer is the Founder of the Works of Elohim International Inc.  She is the Director of the Omega Mansion/Bronzeville, an Entrepreneur and Author of Books: "Don't Shoot - I'm Already Wounded," "Morning Glory," - Book of Poems, "A Mother's Love" - Keep Sake Journal, and "Come and Dine" - A soulful Cook Book, and others to come.  Passionate Worshippers of Yeshua/Jesus.  I love, love hosting travelers from around the world. Five things I can't live without:  My relationship with my Saviour, prayer,  the convenience of technology, sparkling clean house, and grandkids. My favorite travel destinations: Hawaii, and  the UK, and Etc.  Books: The KJV Bible,  The Spook who sat by the door, To Kill A marking Bird, Langston Hughes, and Etc. name: Cozy bedroom in spacious apartment
description:
You will love your spacious, dog friendly, furnished, 2 bedroom Duplex apartment. During your stay, take a nice stroll in beautiful Humboldt Park, go shopping in artsy Wicker Park or take a quick L ride to sight see Downtown or North side Chicago.

The space
Private room in spacious apartment.

**We take cleanliness VERY seriously. Your home will be throughoutly cleaned to CDC guidelines

**We are an LGBTQ+ POC friendly home. We welcome ALL lifestyles ALL People.

Our very clean, vintage, spacious duplex apartment is one of the most unique spaces in Humboldt Park. Before this was an apartment, it was a community center for the neighborhood! The upstairs is a spacious two-bedroom apartment with an open floor plan. Some features include a dramatic vintage built in mirror, comfy sectional couch, formal dining room and very high ceilings. Downstairs is an artist's studio with an open floor plan with a bathroom and an office. We have
neighborhood_overview:
HUMBOLDT PARK
Our neighborhood is called Humboldt Park which is an up and coming area. Recently named the "WOW District", the real estate is booming and businesses are popping up like wildfire. Artists and young professionals are moving in and opening up art galleries and vintage inspired stores. The main street closest to our house is called "North Ave." There is a grocery store, several vintage shops for men and women, furniture stores, a coffee shop and art galleries.


The apartment is down the street from 2 of the coolest parks in Chicago. Humboldt Park is the most gorgeous place where you will see a boathouse from the late 1800s, wild life like ducks and geese and a nature preserve. It is one of our favorite parts of our neighborhood. We also live down the street from the 606, an elevated park that used to be a railroad! It's a super rad park that you can walk, bike or run east or west that has entrances and exits throughout.

We welcome gu
host_about:
Hi! We're Laura and Joel! Laura is from Miami, Florida and Joel is from Lansing, Michigan.  We are both in our late 20s and moved to Chicago to be actors.  We are always in a play or auditioning for our next gig. We met in school at Columbia College Chicago and got our degrees in Acting.  We got married in September, 2015. 

Laura owns her own business, she is an event planner and plans parties for people! Joel is a licensed tour boat captain. 

We are super friendly, fun and outgoing. We're social butterflies and we absolutely love hosting!  We really enjoy meeting new people and helping them experience our beautiful city.  As actors we are really open-minded people and love being around a diverse crowd. Chicago is an exciting city to be an artist! We have a wonderfully supportive and talented community of friends. When we aren't hosting Air Bnb guests, we love to invite friends over to rehearse some theater or join us for a dinner party or BBQ! 

We are year long bike riders, we love listening to Radiohead, we enjoy cooking yummy vegan meals, and we love a good movie.

description:
Your private room is located in one of the best neighborhoods in Chicago. We are located in Bucktown and are a 8 minute walk (one el stop away) from both Wicker Park and Logan Square...and a short ride to the Loop. Enjoy a true Chicago experience.

The space
Your comfortable, private room is located in the first floor apartment of our private home. We use the first floor as a freelance graphic design office. Your bedroom is one of two rooms we offer on airbnb (the other room is https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/4667333?s=-FGw). The room is always completely private, and the rest of the apartment is for your use as well. The office space is generally in use during business hours, but we use it during nights and weekends since I use the space to oil paint as well.

We have three kids who may wake up at 6:30 and start running around. They do not realize how this sounds to our guest and they are working on it. You will have to consider this as part of the
neighborhood_overview: Bucktown and Wicker Park are really fun neighborhoods to visit.  There are plenty of shops, restaurants, bar, coffee shops, and clubs.  There is a free pool a block away.
host_about:
Hi, we are Brad Miller and Carrie Hood.  We live in Chicago with our three children.  After having such great times traveling with AirBnB to San Francisco and Michigan, we're inspired to try it ourselves.  We are excited to host guests and share this great city with travelers.

We rehabbed the bottom unit of our house as a rental unit, but currently use it to run a design business.  Our out of town guests stay in that unit, so it's perfect for AirBnB.  We're excited to get the best us of our guest space.

It will be a pleasure to share our home that we love.

name: Great space in hip neighborhood!
description:
If you are looking for a clean apartment in a great neighborhood in Chicago, this is it! Easy access to both downtown and hip Bucktown/Wicker Park neighborhood.

The space
This space is right between the hip areas of West Loop and Bucktown, and minutes away from downtown.

Guest access
Queen size bed, perfect for 1-2 people. Air conditioning in entire apt. Shared bathroom, but it is just me, and I'm not around much! Coin laundry in the basement of the bldg. Computer, internet, printer, and scanner available.

Other things to note
The apartment is on the third-floor of a third floor walk-up, just to let you know in case you have trouble getting up and down stairs.
Also, my neighbor controls the light on the 2nd floor landing, and she sometimes forgets to turn it on. Not a huge deal, as I keep my light on, but just a heads up. Some of my pickier guests have complained....:)

License number
neighborhood_overview: I love that my neighborhood is a mix of gentrified stores (read: Starbucks), and mom-and-pop restaurants and bars.  It is completely safe to walk around, and several parks nearby.  I love that it is near the hip neighborhoods, but not in the middle of them!
host_about: I am a math teacher living in Chicago!

The space
Enjoy a stay at a world travelers' Windy City home!

name: Urban Farm Fun!  Walk to Metra/CTA
description:
This cozy one bedroom apartment has a full kitchen, decorative fire place and spa bath. Right out your back door is a fully functioning organic farm with goats, chickens, bees and pigs. Have a fresh omelet before you take the 10 min train ride downtown!

The space
A farm on the West Side of Chicago? Yep, that's unique!

Guest access
CTA Green Line will have you down town, to the lake or to Michigan Ave in 11 minutes. Moments to the United Center for a concert, Hawks or Bulls game. Easy access to highways. Plenty of free parking. The bedroom has a comfy queen bed. There are two full size, fold down sofa beds in the main room. The yard is at your disposal with a grill, smoker and patio. There is a bike share Divy station a short walk away.

Other things to note
The unit is a garden unit with free laundry and Wi-Fi. There is a grill and smoker. We sometimes have bikes you can borrow and occasionally a car. We do req
neighborhood_overview: East Garfield Park is definitely the inner city!  It's also erupting with art.  A nationally recognized art corridor both highbrow and underground.  Think SoHo in the 70's.  We like to run our rebel flag high here.  Stop at a beer tasting, check out a painting at a loft gallery, see some mud wrestling, milk a goat and buy some fresh Chevre, grab some BBQ all in one walk.
host_about: Our quality of life depends on how well we deal with adversity!  Feel positive. Live positive.  I grew up in a small coastal town in Maine.  When I turned 19 I realized that I was a closet wanderer.  So I hit the road and covered much of the U.S. and all of Europe.  I taught skiing in the Rockies and rode my BMW R65-LS from coast to coast.  When I was in Europe I was amazed at how willing people were to open their homes to a total stranger.  I had one of my best experiences living with a family in Romania in the Carpathian Mountains.  Amazing!  I feel this is the best way possible to travel.  It's part of why I love Air B&B.  Hotel shmotel!  Live the life of the area.  That's an experience.  Now my wandering days are over.  I'm rooted in one of the coolest communities I know.  Rich with art and spirit. I have two amazing girls that help me garden, can, collect eggs and milk.  My partner is a fellow East Coast boy, avid hockey player and my right hand man. I also tour with an ABBA tribute band as well as a Pink Floyd tribute band but don't hold that against me.  I hope you like it here half as much as we do!!

name: Bright Spacious 2 BR
description:
Beautiful hardwood floors throughout this bright 2 nd floor apartment on the northwest side of Chicago. Updated modern kitchen and bath with all conveniences including laundry. Easy access to airport and highways. Parking on quiet tree lined street.

The space
This space has a bright and open floor plan and has recently been completely remodeled! Stocked with all the kitchen gadgets you may need including a Keurig coffee maker, spices and olive oil.

Guest access
Guests have a private entrance and small back deck. Guests are welcome to share communal space in the back yard and enjoy the garden.

Other things to note
When we are able, we enjoy meeting our guests and introducing them to the space. This isn't always possible with our schedules so check in arrangements will be given before your arrival to ensure you have access to the unit.

License number
City registration pending
neighborhood_overview:
We are conveniently located near the main highways that access the downtown and the suburbs. We are close to the airport as well.

There are several parks nearby and a wonderful forest preserve path for walking or biking within walking distance (Caldwell Woods). If traveling in the summer months, there is also Whelan Aquatic Park within walking distance. A great day of fun for kids!
host_about:
I am a health care provider with an emphasis in alternative health.  In addition I instruct individuals and businesses in how to recycle their waste with worms!  My husband is a local caterer and all around handy guy.  We compost year round and maintain an organic garden in our back yard when weather allows.  We welcome our guests to join us in enjoying our urban garden.

We have a pet friendly apartment and enjoy three furry friends of our own; Eve ( grey cat), Emmie (calico cat), and Ms. Pickles ( wacky little dog).  

We love to travel and stay in unique accommodations.  Unfortunately our lives here in Chicago keep us busy and we don't get away often enough.  Hosting helps fill the gap!  It is always interesting to meet our unique guests and hear about where they are from.
