name: Casa Corazón (E) near Rush / UIC
description:
Minutes from Rush University Medical Center and UIC, this home is tucked away in the hidden gem of the "Heart of Chicago" neighborhood. The Loop is located just 5 miles away while McCormick Place is accessible by a 20-minute direct bus ride.

The space
Your room is bright and airy with a comfy bed dressed in fresh sheets, fluffy pillows and snuggly blankets. If you are the culinary kind, our kitchen has all the tools you'll need for you to feel right at home. Your bathroom is shared.

Details:
– Twin bed
– Fresh linens and towels
– Shared bath
– Free WiFi
– On-street parking
– Use of washer / dryer
– Full use of gourmet kitchen
– Access to front balcony

* Please note that this room does not have a closet. However, there is plenty of room under the bed for your luggage and hooks on the door for hanging.

Other things to note
Meow:
There is a cat on the premises who keeps to hims
neighborhood_overview: "Heart of Chicago" has a rich ethnic heritage.  Established at the end of the 19th century, it was first inhabited by the Bohemian working class. Since then it has experienced the richness of an Italian population and more recently Hispanic. Our house is right around the corner from a handful of some of the remaining old school Italian restaurants and taquerias can be found on most corners.
host_about: I am a sculptor with a love for language and new cultural experiences. I am kind and warm with a preference for books over devices and people over profiles.

name: Ukrainian Village Apartment
description:
Lovely one bedroom apartment in Ukrainian Village. Exposed brick & modern feel. Nice deck. Close to public transit & easy connection to O'Hare & Union Station via the Blue Line 'L'. Restaurants & cafes just steps away.

The space
The apartment has one queen size bed in the bedroom. It also has a sofa bed in the living room for one additional guest if needed. Check-in time is 2 pm & check-out at noon. Please let us know in advance if you are arriving earlier or need to leave later. We are happy to be flexible when possible.

Guest access
Please note that the entrance to our unit is via a SIDE gate to the right of the building. A lockbox is located on the gate containing the keys needed to get into the building and apartment. The apartment has fast - 75Mbps -wireless internet. Fully equipped kitchen. A washer and dryer are also in the apartment, so are towels, sheets, soap, shampoo, hairdryer & straightener, iron & ironing board. Outdoor deck
neighborhood_overview: Great area for walking and biking. Diverse neighborhood with several community vegetable & flower gardens and a unique mix of modern & traditional architecture. Many restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops. Grocery shop in walking distance. Just a 15 minute walk to the 606 Bloomingdale Trail with easy access from Damen Avenue.
host_about: Anders and I live in St. Louis but we go up to Chicago frequently. Anders is originally from Sweden and I am from Germany. We love to travel and spend a few months each year in Europe.

Perfect place to start out in Chicago. High-quality furnished. Just bring your suitcase, I have everything else. Medical student, foreign student, out-of-town intern, relocated professional welcome.

Full-size bed with high quality bed linen, pillow, blanket. Study desk and chair. Flat-screen smart TV in living room. WIFI. Free use of washer/dryer in basement. Kitchen is well equipped for light cooking with basic dinner wares and utensils, as well as toaster, cooking pan, kettle, microwave, refrigerator, range/oven. host_about:
Hi! I am a friendly and easy-going host. My background is in graphic design, interior design, and computer programming. My goal is to make sure you enjoy the stay as much as i can. I am also a licensed real estate broker in IL with over 10 years of experience in property rentals.

Originally from Thailand but have lived in Chicago for over 25 years. In my free time, i enjoy gardening, biking, hiking, and exploring new restaurants. It is my pleasure to recommend local-favorite spots, or to provide info on transportations, etc.  

We respect your privacy, courteous, well-organized, responsive to your requests, and clean.  

I travel often. I usually pick up new tips from other airbnb hosts to enhance my guest experiences. I greatly appreciate your support. You may expect that I will go extra miles to ensure that you enjoy your stay.

Wrigley Hostel is an excellent hostel located in the heart of Wrigleyville, one of the most fun and exciting neighborhoods in Chicago. We offer a private dorm room for up to 4 guests with free breakfast.

The space
Wrigley Hostel offers you a private 4-bed room for up to 4 guests at our brand new guest house just down the street from Wrigley Field. The room comes with 2 bunk beds with fresh, clean linens. There are shared bathrooms throughout our building.

Guest access
Guests have access to the hostel's kitchen facilities and social spaces, including an outdoor patio and a common room complete with a TV, bar, and laptops that are free to use.

The space
Your bedroom has 2 West-facing windows, and has a full-size bed in a 1st-floor vintage rehabbed apartment in Chicago's Wicker Park. The living room and kitchen are open concept, the bathroom has a tub and shower. Central air and heat, wireless internet. There is a backyard with deck and herb garden. The space is ideal for one or two guests, with another one or two fitting comfortably on the sofa or on a provided air mattress, but you might be a little cramped at that point. Towels and washcloths are available for your use.

I work from home, and am often on the property, and I am happy to recommend places to eat as well as some off the unique non-tourist destinations around Chicago. Want to k

description:

description:
STUDIO Luxury New - extra Clean apartment - the premiere rental residence located between River North and the West Loop. Fully furnished and equipped perfectly for a short or long stay! Pool, Hot Tub, Gym!

The space
Elevate Your Lifestyle

Behind the storefront is a house with YOUR OWN private COVID safe use of kitchen, bathroom, dining, living room, back garden area and bedroom with new queen size bed (with allergy and bedbug cover). First floor wheelchair accessible doors throughout with large bathroom ! This spot is close to many bus and train lines. Pilsen Rocks!

The space
This is a rare combination of an actual art studio/ store not being used this 2021 summer with a wonderful historic brick home connected right behind it . Renting an additional private upstairs room with another queen size bed and side room with single bed with an additional upstairs full bathroom with backdoor side exit may be available as well for an additional price on request.

Guest access

neighborhood_overview: The street is filled with houses that are over 100 years old with friendly neighbors .This neighborhood is very close to the old Italian restaurant row. Of course, it is also in walking distance to all of  the action of Pilsen's Mexican style 18th street cool cafe's, bars, late night taquerias. The  Mexican Fine Arts Museum is a few blocks away and is free and possibly back to being open 7 days a week ! One block away are more traditional Mexican bakeries and ice cream shops on Cermak Avenue. To the east is Chinatown . One short PINK Line/ Damen CTA train ( with a wheelchair accessible elevator) or bus ride is Chicago's downtown and the magnificent Lake Michigan or east on Cermak to McCormick Center.
host_about:

The space
This is a perfect apartment and location for a short-term stay. The apartment has a queen size bed and can accommodate 1 or 2 people. The building is located in a residential neighborhood, but is a short walk or commute to downtown Chicago. It's steps to several grocery stores, countless restaurants and shops. Walk to Michigan Avenue or the lakefront.

Guest access

name: Warm Cozy Guest Suite, Private Bath
description:
This cozy guest room is 1 of 3 bedrooms in a rehabbed condo, in the historic, culturally rich Bronzeville/Hyde Park community. Enjoy a gourmet kitchen, fabulous art collection, gas fireplace and 2 outdoor spaces. Near 5 major transportation lines.

The space
Charming, unique, cool, fun, cozy, vintage, eclectic, and warm, are terms that have been used to describe YOUR "home away from home".

Weather you're an artist here for a show, a tourist, a professional on a temporary assignment, a graduate student, or just wanting to explore Chicago, this is the perfect centrally located, affordable space for you.

This 2200 sq ft, 3 bedroom, 2.5 bath, rehabbed CONDO in the historic Bronzeville/Hyde Park community is the perfect spot for all adult travelers.

My home includes: two outdoor spaces, a cozy living room with gas fireplace, a sun-drenched den off the living room, in unit laundry room, separate dining room, and a modern gour
neighborhood_overview: The city of Chicago is comprised of 77 "official" communities.  Bronzeville is the name given to a collection of communities located within the boundaries of the restrictive covenants from early to mid 1900.  These communities are primarily Washington Park, Grand Blvd., Oakland, Douglas and portions of neighboring communities.  Bronzeville is a vibrant, historic, culturally rich, and exciting community, that is said to be one of the most studied communities in the country, along with Harlem.  I was born in Bronzeville, and intentionally returned here as an adult because of it's enormous legacy.
host_about:
My life motto......."to thine own self be true".......and have fun doing it !!
I'm peaceful, energetic, fun-loving, active and love to be (Website hidden by Airbnb) the summer, spring, and fall!!  I LOVE travel (usually to someplace warm), art, food, entertaining, meeting new people and lively conversation.  I'm an avid art collector, jewelry designer, and art festival "junkie", that likes to experiment in the kitchen. Jewelry design is a newly discovered passion, and I sell my work at venues around the country.

Travel is in my blood !! I'm a native Chicagoan who was raised around the world as my father was in the Air Force.  I've lived in Germany, Paris, California and Texas.  As an adult, I've traveled throughout the U.S., Canada, and the Caribbean both for work and play.  I love meeting and hosting other travelers. 

I spent many years in the corporate and non-profit arenas, and have been self-employed in some form for as long as I can remember.

name: Private room near Downtown
description:
The space
If you're looking for a true Chicago neighborhood experience, look no further! I have a private room available in East Pilsen, a diverse neighborhood near downtown Chicago. The neighborhood is thriving with city life and the beautiful murals that bleed from its walls are a testament to its pulse. The apartment is situated just two blocks west of the arts district and a short walk from UIC, and downtown is conveniently located just 2 miles away. In addition, Chinatown, Greektown, and Little Italy are also nearby. It's fun to experience these neighborhoods on a bike ride and there is a Divvy bike station located on the next block. Access to the train or bus is undemanding. However, if you prefer to drive, a Zip Car parking space is located within 2 blocks.
The apartment has two bedrooms and a single bathroom. Wireless internet and cable are available. For your convenience, there is also a washer and dryer in the unit.
Plenty of bars, cafes, and restauran

name: Chicago Women's Residence/Cowgirls
description:
A Room of Your Own in this Travelers' Residence for Women. See the real Chicago, easy access to public transportation, enjoy meeting other guests. Have a safe, affordable place to hang your hat while staying in Chicago and seeing the sights.

The space
Funky Artist's place with small gallery & art studio plus garden. 2nd floor women's residence with 4 bedrooms for women travelers! Each woman (or 2 in a room) gets her own bedroom and shares the common spaces. Sitting room with library, t.v., full kitchen with everything needed to cook & bake, bathroom with claw foot tub & shower, plus deck off the back going to the garden. All rooms are totally furnished even with linens, art on display, and knick knacks! Each room has a name- Frida Khalo Kitchen, Pink Flamingo Bathroom, Even Cowgirls Get the Blues single bedroom, Bette Midler bedroom, Florence Comfy bedroom, the Paris Bedroom. No white walls- all bright colors! daily rate and monthly rate per room. payment expect
neighborhood_overview:
This is a residential mostly African American neighborhood. We know each other. There is a feeling of spaciousness and real life here. Plenty of families, children, and old folks in this area. People say hello on the sidewalks when they pass each other!
It is easy to walk around here. Plenty to walk to and do. We are close to the large Douglas Park. It has a cultural center with lots to do including in the summer a large outdoor swimming pool.
It is easy to catch a bus one block away and go to Chinatown and have fun looking around. It is easy to catch the train 2 blocks away and go downtown where there are million things to do- many are free! The park has a lagoon and fishing and bird watching are free! United Center for games and events is extremely close.
We have a lot of trees in the neighborhood. it borders a Latino neighborhood so walking distance to lots of great Mexican food and art!
host_about: artist dog lover!

name: Basement Studio w/Free St. Parking, Humboldt Park
description:
Located in Humboldt Park, 6 miles from downtown, this basement studio is perfect for a stay in Chicago. We are located on a strip with approximately 11 houses and no houses across. There is a lot of Park area. At night it's a quiet neighborhood. We are located half a block away from the bus to Navy Pier, approx. 45 minutes to get to Navy Pier. There is free street parking available with NO parking permit required. There is a pool (only in summer) and park access half a block away.

The space
Our lovely basement is fully equipped with everything you may need. From a kitchen where you can prepare all your meals to a comfy bed with linens included for a good night sleep. Feel free to peak inside the closet and the vanity in the bathroom, you will find some useful toiletries you forgot back at home.

The building is 3 stories. The Basement, 1st Floor and 2nd Floor. Both the Basement and the 1st floor are rented out thru airbnb. Because this house is more th
neighborhood_overview: Please take a minute to look at all the pictures. There you will find pictures of the neighborhood, Humboldt Park. During the day it's lovely to walk around but at night it's a quiet residential strip of 12 houses.  It's located 6 miles (9km) from downtown.
host_about:
Hola! Thank you so much for taking the time to read a bit about myself. I will start out by saying that to me there's nothing like a good conversation. I love talking about geography, different cultures and even finances. 

My true passion is hosting. I would love to dedicate to it full time sooner rather than later. After having studied abroad for 3 years, more than taking myself around the world, I want to show Puerto Rico and Chicago to the world. If you're curious, I was born and raised in paradise: Puerto Rico!

I know how much guests value when a host personally welcomes them, however due to work and being between Puerto Rico and Chicago, unfortunately I'm not available to greet each guest personally. Regardless, I can guarantee that all my places will make you feel like at home. I have put a lot of effort and love into getting them setup. Each one of our listings ("our" because my mom is the big helper) has been available for hosting after both my mom and I have stayed at each one and have approved them. We will say we are quite into the details; if you are too, I'm sure you'll notice.  

About me, I can't live without traveling, those deep conversations that by the end have made you question yourself and of course I most definitely can't live without Pancho! Pancho is my son (well, my dog) whom I just spoil too much. I rescued him from the streets of Puerto Rico and ever since we have been partners in crime. 

FOOD! Almost forgot about that one. Can't live without it! I love trying new dishes so if I'm around and you feel like cooking and exchanging recipes, let's do it! 

I love hosting guests that have positive vibes, are relaxed and know how to make the most out of every moment.

My favorite two board games are Mancala and Rummikub so if you think you can take a challenge, I'm more than willing to play! ;-)

Favorite quote: "If you judge a fish by it's ability to climb a tree, it will live it's whole life thinking it's stupid." A.Einstein

name: Prime Wicker Park spot+big apartment+free parking
description:
Welcome to our apartment in the heart of Wicker Park!

We have owned this apartment since early 2014 and have had a lot of terrific guests over that time. A 5-minute walk from the Damen Blue Line 'L' train stop, you'll be close by some great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and city parks.

This is a rental for the entire place-- you will have the entire place to yourself, including your own bedroom, bathroom, & parking spot. Your room has a dresser, queen size bed, & large closet.

The space
This is a great location. You're tucked away in a quiet area of Wicker Park, but in just a short walk you find yourself in the center of a bustling neighborhood with tons of great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and boutique stores.

Hop on the Blue Line (just a few minute walk away) and head right in the Loop. Easy access to anywhere you want to get in the city.

Also, if you're coming into O'Hare, taking the Blue Line from the airp
neighborhood_overview:
Fantastic neighborhood with wonderful food options and easy access to public transportation. The "606" trail is located nearby as well.

For some great recommendations, check out our Guidebook. We also provide a Yelp collection. Airbnb doesn't let us share links here, but message us and we'll send you the Yelp link!
host_about:
I'm a Software Developer at a consultancy in downtown Chicago. I'm a laid back person who loves watching sports and hanging out with friends in the city.

I own this apartment and have lived here with my girlfriend since 2014.

name: Cozy Single-Family Home near University of Chicago
description:
Comfortable House in Hyde Park: This beautiful Victorian cottage was built in 1884 and has been thoughtfully renovated. Three bedrooms, all cotton sheets, one full bathroom, one half-bathroom, a cook's kitchen, living room and dining room. Located near the U of C, and one block to the commuter train station—easy walk to campus and 13-min ride downtown. It's a small, cozy home on a quiet street, with a flower garden in front, and a little farmyard out back. Fast WiFi. You are welcome here!

The space
The house is a wood-framed Eastlake Victorian Cottage built in 1884 for lakefront vacation rentals. It's been renovated to a comfy-funky style, and is an aspirational urban homestead with a farm and shop out back. There are hens and a rooster—the rooster crows with the sunrise early in the morning, and throughout the day as he sees fit. No one knows why.
The three bedrooms are small—in the style of the time it was built—and comfortable. Each has a queen-sized be
neighborhood_overview:
The house is essentially on the University of Chicago Campus, on an beautiful block between the International House and the new Lab School Elementary School.
Within five blocks of the house: Coffee shops, great breakfast joints, places for sandwiches and salads, a range of restaurants from diner to dancey, a small funky friendly grocery store and a big boring grocery store, great bookstores (new and used), lots of parks, the beautiful shore of Lake Michigan, and quick easy rides downtown on train and bus.
host_about: I run the Chicago Honeybee Rescue (ask me anything about social stinging insects!), am an open-water swimmer in Lake Michigan, woodworker and proprietor of Walker Lane Tools—selling beautiful hand tools for woodworking.

name: Magnolia Airbnb
description:
Sunny, large bedroom with en-suite shower/bathroom in a warm, comfortable home on a quiet, tree-lined street in Edgewater neighborhood. Conveniently located with just short walk to two Red Line train stations and four short blocks from the beaches of Lake Michigan.

The space
Chicago style Arts and Crafts house, built at the turn of 20th century in Edgewater. My home is roomy and comfortable with ample privacy and lots of eclectic art work. Quiet, large bedroom with a king-sized Tempurpedic bed and en-suite bathroom with a shower. Behind the plain exterior of the house is a peaceful and spacious sanctuary to renew and refresh yourself. Access to wireless internet, back yard and the bbq grill.

In the summer, you can pick organic arugula, basil and other vegetables from the backyard for a delicious salad or sandwich.

Get a taste of real Chicago, while staying in a quiet, tree-lined neighborhood!

Although, the official check-i
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location, as the saying goes! It's the Edgewater neighborhood. Edgewater, as the name suggests, is at the edge of beautiful Lake Michigan. Just blocks away from the beautiful Lake Michigan, you will love walking to the lakefront to watch the sunrise (if you are an early morning person, like me), jogging, walking or just about anything at the lake.

Magnolia B & C is within short walking distance to many restaurants and shops in Edgewater and Andersonville. New Chinatown on Argyle Street and Indian food on Devon Avenue are very close. Anywhere from upscale Italian eateries to family diners are all nearby. The variety and choice of restaurants will meet any budget. Closest grocery store, Wholefoods, is just a short walk from the house. It is only two elevated train stops away from Loyola University. Easy access to Northwestern downtown and Evanston campuses.
host_about:
Lover of the arts, travel, books and hiking.  I enjoy music of all kinds and of course yummy food.  I love meeting people from different cultures and learning about them.   

As a citizen of this planet, I am mindful of our tendency for overconsumption and try to do my part to make sure that this planet sustains itself for another few millennia.
